title: Responding to William Lane Craig on the Atonement
description:
In this video I respond to claims made by William Lane Craig of @ReasonableFaithOrg and Sean McDowell of @SeanMcDowell and their criticism of Andrew Rillera's book Lamb of the Free - a Biblical critique of Penal Substitution. I show why their review misrepresents both the scholarship and the biblical data. I demonstrate that Craig actually rejects or softens most of Penal Substitutionary Atonement‚Äôs historic claims, creating a ‚ÄúMotte & Bailey‚Äù PSA which is mild and vague in public, but far more punitive in his academic writings. We walk through the 17 historical claims of PSA and show how removing even one weakens or collapses the system. I address Craig‚Äôs claims that Rillera ‚Äúignored Isaiah 53,‚Äù ‚Äúdenies substitution,‚Äù and ‚Äúdenies atonement,‚Äù and show that each of these accusations is factually wrong. I also address Craig‚Äôs labeling of Rillera's work as progressive.

#Atonement #Christianity #Jesus

title: Rocking the Hymnal - Album Preview
description:
Join Idol Killer to hear a sneak peak of the upcoming Album, "Rocking the Hymnal". These are not just hymns with electric guitars and drums, but instead completely retooled melodies & in some cases slight reworking of the lyrics or song structure - without losing the original song's meaning & all while respecting the source material. Additionally, these hymns are mostly buried gems, far from being well-known like Amazing Grace, How Great Thou Art, or A Mighty Fortress. The album takes the lyrics from classic Christian hymns (mostly from the 1700's & 1800's) and breathes new life into them, reinterpreting them as alt pop & melodic metal. Beautiful, rocking, and definitely thought provoking!

The full album releases across major music streaming services November 19, 2025, so be sure to Pre-Save it now so you'll be alerted as soon as it premieres.

title: Todd Friel's Wretched Defense of PSA
description:
Todd Friel of @WretchedNetwork recently released a video addressing the Book "Lamb of the Free" by Andrew Rillera, as well as John Mark Comer's endorsement of it - but really the entire program was Todd erecting strawmen, claiming the Early Church's views for the Work of Christ were no different than Islam, denying these views were Biblical only to turn around and affirm they were Biblical, claiming these other Models were the fruit of Penal Substitution (PSA) while claiming there's "no chance" they're sound. To say Todd was contradictory, unBiblical and illogical would be an understatement. What a tangled knot he wove!

title: Freedom on Trial - Condemnation of 1277
description:
On January 18, 1277 Pope John XXI wrote a letter to Stephen Tempier, Bishop of Paris. In that letter the Pope noted he had heard rumors of heresy and charged Tempier with the task of examining the source of these errors. On March 7, 1277, Bishop Tempier published a list of 219 theological and philosophical theses (and of some books) that were condemned. Anyone teaching the identified errors would be excommunicated, unless they turned themselves in to face the appropriate penalties. What were these errors, what followed, how does this relate to views of God's omniscience like Calvinism, Molinism and Dynamic Omniscience and why should we care?

#omniscience #christian #christianity

title: What's Wrong with Molinism?
description:
Let's do a deep dive into the concept of Molinism and Middle Knowledge. 

Molinists affirm God has "Middle Knowledge", that for every metaphysically possible indeterministic scenario (one in which free creatures could choose differently) God supposedly has infallible, pre-volitional knowledge of what precisely would happen. 

This assumes that there is a single, determinate truth about how each creature would freely choose... even in indeterministic situations. But that‚Äôs a highly questionable assumption, since by definition, indeterministic scenarios allow for more than one possible outcome. If multiple outcomes are truly possible, there shouldn‚Äôt be one fixed fact about what would happen.
Molinists claim that God uses this Middle Knowledge to choose to create a world where free creatures do exactly what He wants.

I recently offered a critique of Molinism on Facebook, which prompted Tim Stratton of @FreethinkingMinistries to write an article in response. This video reviews some of my concerns over Molinism and responds to the claims made in Tim's article. 

***Go subscribe to Tim's channel and tell him Idol Killer sent you***

Tim's article:
https://freethinkingministries.com/does-molinism-collapse-into-determinism-a-friendly-response-to-idol-killer/?fbclid=IwY2xjawJky-BleHRuA2FlbQIxMQABHgFgYTnGoLEKGxl8HWgDiUmMjaC1gUEqyD8s7mBgo4EY_6_M7kYRjo17k7d2_aem_AE1OZyd8wDtw7-g8lUYHmQ

Alan Rhoda's article:
http://alanrhoda.net/wordpress/2021/12/a-quick-refutation-of-molinism/?fbclid=IwY2xjawJkzJdleHRuA2FlbQIxMAABHoxZtf0cO7uaivgCO7odaYS4-1ukzz6yLhgiIsjK-Ks74MGku6kTSy_y_AXw_aem_51Hho3583r7sLWqw5GMjMg

title: Word Games: When Theology Twists the Bible
description:
The Bible is God's self-revelation and while Christians may often be at odds over how to interpret a particular passage, one group consistently denies God's self-revelation in favor of the pagan philosophy of Plato. In doing so, it fails to meet the test for the false gods which the Holy & Living God set forth in Isaiah.

Classical Theism is a philosophical and theological framework for understanding God that emphasizes divine attributes such as immutability (unchanging), impassibility (incapable of suffering or being emotionally affected), simplicity (all of God's actions and attributes are God), atemporality (existing in a single timeless moment of pure actuality), and aseity (self-existent and dependent on nothing).

At its core, Classical Theism is rooted in Platonist metaphysics rather than a literal reading of the Bible. This influence can be seen in several ways:

Plato's concept of the Forms - eternal, unchanging ideals - shaped the idea that God must also be unchanging and perfect. Change, in Plato‚Äôs thought, implies imperfection or potential, which cannot apply to a perfect being.

The Neoplatonism of thinkers like Plotinus further developed the idea of "The One" as the ultimate, simple, and wholly transcendent source of all being, which was then adopted and adapted by Christian theologians like Augustine and Thomas Aquinas.

These philosophical commitments led Classical Theists to reinterpret biblical descriptions of God (e.g., God being angry, relenting, grieving, or acting in time) as nothing more than figurative language meant to accommodate human understanding, not literal descriptions of God.

In short, Classical Theism prioritizes philosophical coherence with Platonic ideals over a plain, literal reading of Scripture, often subordinating the dynamic, relational, and emotional depictions of God in the Bible to metaphysical principles drawn from Hellenistic philosophy.

In this video, we address some of the things God says about Himself, which were affirmed by the Apostles and Prophets, but which the Classical Theist rejects.

#ClassicalTheism #christian #philosophy

title: God Rest You Wary, Gentlemen - Honest Calvinist Holiday Song
description:

Lyrics:

God rest ye wary gentlemen,
Let caution be your guide,
Calvin‚Äôs watchful eye is near,
Sovereignty must abide.
If you should doubt or disobey,
There's nowhere to hide,
Oh, tidings of conform or fear,
(conform or fear)
Oh, tidings of conform or fear.

The city walls of Geneva stand,
With statutes carved in stone,
A fortress of theology,
Where grace is not your own.
Step out of line, and you may find
Slow burning fire your home,
Oh, tidings of conform or fear,
(Conform or fear)
Oh, tidings of conform or fear.

Predestined paths are tightly drawn,
No room to turn or stray,
For Calvin‚Äôs rules will hem you in,
And keep all doubt at bay.
Submit your will, or pay the price,
For mercy‚Äôs not today,
Oh, tidings of conform or fear,
(Conform or fear)
Oh, tidings of conform or fear.

So rest ye wary gentlemen,
Let vigilance be keen,
For Calvin‚Äôs reach extends beyond
The places you have seen.
Obey his creed, and you will find
Peace is never truly free.
Oh, tidings of conform or fear,

Oh, tidings of conform or fear.

title: Responding to Closed Theists
description:
Recently the folks behind @christicommunity called Warren McGrew of Idol Killer and Chris Fisher of @realityisnotoptional popular.  That would have been swell had they stopped there. However, they continued the sentence... "popular false teachers" and included others such as Chris Date, Michael Licona, and Greg Boyd.

Among their criticism of McGrew, Fisher and Boyd they wrote: "These teachers embrace the wrong idea that God learns the future and that he does not know the future with 100% accuracy since the future does not exist to us or God (unorthodox view of God; finite godism)."

Warren commented on this, stating he does indeed affirm God knows the future and that Dynamic Omniscience (at least in its mere form) is essential to Christian Orthodoxy. He noted there were two possibilities for the misrepresentations made by Christicommunity... either innocent misunderstanding and ignorance, or intentional misrepresentation and dishonesty.

Yet, Christicommunity refused to accept Warren's beliefs as stated and even attacked the idea of God being free to create or not (themselves rejecting Christian orthodoxy in favor of fatalism). They linked to this video wherein they "refute" Open Theism and Dynamic Omniscience - which is what we address here.

The video we are responding to: https://youtu.be/bISzPGwU42I?si=r4ToZZjLtHpQZgyG

title: Debate Review - Rogue Calvinist on Total Depravity
description:
Recently Warren McGrew of Idol Killer debated the man behind the @roguecalvinist YouTube Channel on @StandingForTruthMinistries. The debate proposition was "Total Depravity is True" and Scott affirmed the positive while Warren assumed the burden of the negative. To be fair to Scott, this was his first formal debate whereas it was Warren's sixth debate - his seventh if you count the open panel discussion on the Gospel Truth's channel (with Matt Slick, Vocab Malone & Chris Fisher). 

Watch the full debate with Rogue: https://www.youtube.com/live/jTjjkHxOA6Q?si=em_zPlnJcdQRTysV

Beware cloaked figures bearing tulips.

In this broadcast, Warren will review the events leading up to the debate, the debate itself and the subsequent fallout from that debate. This is sure to cause folks to get upset and certainly bad behavior needs called out, but remember Scott claimed to have been born again in the Fall of 2021, he has no formal training on Scripture and this is his first debate - so let's cut him some slack.

Moderated debates are a bizarre animal and learning the format, how to operate, how to prepare and present an argument, how to operate in the cross examination, when to make a closing statement... there's a lot of components to learn. Adding to this the fact that it's being broadcast live and will likely remain online for the foreseeable future, and it can be extremely stressful. No one performs perfectly in a debate. We all make mistakes, and this is all the more common the newer we are at such forums. 

Did Rogue make numerous errors in debate etiquette? Absolutely. Is this something we should jump on and use to dismiss his arguments? Absolutely not. An argument needs to be considered on its merits. It must be stressed we consider the arguments as they're offered and see if they rise or fall, regardless of who is making them.

Did Rogue eisegete the text, fail to understand it and make contradictory claims? Absolutely, and this is where we should focus our attention.

Did Rogue behave poorly? His repeated claim that Warren is unregenerate and unable to understand spiritual truth was indeed poor behavior. Rogue often seemed to shut down, get frustrated, raise his voice and engage in ad hominem, failing to understand many of Warren's arguments, or avoiding them as best he could... and while this deserves calling out, we still must consider his arguments.

title: The Program - Your First Reformed Church Service
description:
This song was inspired when I was considering how many Churches offer a Program to attendees. This got me thinking about how Calvinists indoctrinate unsuspecting Christians into their systematic, redefining terms and concepts... but also how they believe we're preprgrammed to believe lies (John MacArthur) and how they believe God from all eternity decreed whatsoever comes to pass like we're all just following our programming or some secret script. All of these ideas were swirling around in my head and this is the end result. 

I wanted the music to evoke discomfort between the melodic and discordant, reflecting this tension between being greeted so warmly and welcomed in to the group, and that dread and foreboding arising from the realization they're teaching opposes God's self-revelation in Scripture. So I chose post-hardcore and mathrock. Then for the visual styling, I wanted to carry this theme forward, so I presented the lyrics in constantly changing formats so as to maintain this sense of vertigo so frequently experienced by new Christians when they encounter Calvinism. 

LYRICS:

Oh, hello there
Let me get the door
Is this your first time here?
Out in the lobby
Grab a muffin and some coffee
Don't forget your program
We're so glad you're here

I like your beard
and your ink is pretty rad
the Pastor has full sleeves
and gauges in his ears
Ever heard of Calvinism?
No? That's okay. 
Everyone is welcome

You'll fit right in!

The systematic is beautiful
Nothing less than the Gospel
Don't forget your program
Tulip is the Gospel
Don't question the program!
Just stick to the script!

You'll fit right in!

Give us your children
The nursery's down the hall
Sovereignly indoctrinating
Little tulips on the wall
Turning vipers in diapers
into God's own elect

Everything's predestined, just what did you expect?

Now repeat after me:
"God decreed all sin!
Who are you oh man
To question Calvinism?"
Don't question the program!

You'll fit right in!

title: Anathema - RC Sproul
description:
Over a series of messages and throughout his lifetime, RC Sproul of @ligonier consistently taught that Jesus became impure, sin incarnate, grotesque, obscene, cut off from the Father who couldn't look upon such a mass of concentrated sin, and that Jesus was damned by God, anathema, cut off and cast into outer darkness.

This is not only refuted in passages like Psalm 22 and 1 Corinthians 12:3, but results in numerous Christological and Soteriological problems, splitting the Trinity and pitting the Father against the Son, corrupting and destroying the very nature of God... not to mention distorting the loving, selfless redemptive work of God for us.

Why did RC make such blasphemous claims? Because he was being consistent with Penal Substitutionary Atonement and Federal Headship, rather than Scripture.

Some may object to our criticism, noting Sproul passed away in 2017. However, his teaching is still widely circulated today and is distorting the Gospel and work of Christ. Should we endanger the living out of respect for one who passed away; one who taught blasphemy? No.

We are releasing the Opening Statements here in advance of the debate, so as to facilitate a more robust live discussion between the participants, as well as allow viewers ample time to consider each perspective ahead of the debate.

title: Determined to Suffer - A Response to Theological Determinism
description:
Theological Determinism is a form of predeterminism which states that all events that happen are pre-ordained, and predestined to happen. In this view god is both the arsonist and the fireman, the savior and the abuser, as he is said to have meticulously determined everything with specificity.

This song is dedicated to those who are suffering and believe God decreed their suffering for his own glory. I pray this breaks through and people realize God is better than this.

God doesn't get His kicks by causing men to suffer for His glory. Rather, the God of the Bible took on the totality of human nature, becoming one of us and DETERMINED TO SUFFER for us, to achieve the victory over sin, suffering and death itself - bringing us hope. THIS is what separates the Living God from dead idols.

LYRICS:

When life falls apart, when everything claimed fails,
It hits so hard, being decreed by God!
Who can you look to, where can you go?
There is no safety, only woe!

Can't run away, run away
Can't run away, from your destiny! 

Crushed by the mountain, dreading the blows,
It‚Äôs easy to lose yourself, devil knows:
‚ÄúGod can‚Äôt hear you shouting, He‚Äôs deaf to your plea.
Just take comfort He‚Äôs in control.
Every single sin, every single blow,
God gets all the glory from every single woe!‚Äù

Life‚Äôs so dark, everything‚Äôs a struggle,
Buried under grief, determined to suffer!
Pray to an Arsonist, Abused by a Savior,
Hero and villain, this is determinism

Can't run away, run away
Can't run away, from your destiny! 

Crushed by the mountain, dreading the blows,
It‚Äôs easy to lose yourself, devil knows:
‚ÄúGod can‚Äôt hear you shouting, He‚Äôs deaf to your plea.
Just take comfort He‚Äôs in control.
Every single sin, every single blow,
God gets all the glory from every single woe!‚Äù

Did you ever stop to think for a moment, 
Maybe just maybe, He's not the problem?
That sin and evil are contrary,
Yet He attained the victory!

Crushed by the mountain, dreading the blows,
It‚Äôs easy to lose yourself, God knows!
He hears you shouting, He hears your pleas.
Take comfort in His victory!

Can't run away, run away
Can't run away, from His love! 
(Run home!)

Did you ever stop to think for a moment, 
Maybe just maybe, He's not the problem?
That sin and evil are contrary,
Yet He attained the victory!

Take comfort in His victory!
Every single sin, every single blow,
He redeems each and every single woe!

title: Inability - Come Let Us Reason
description:
The Reformed doctrine of Total Depravity, also referred to as Total Inability, asserts that as a result of Adam's sin in Eden, all his progenty are born spiritually dead, under God's wrath, unable to rightly understand spiritual truths or respond positively to God - that everything that is man, from his flesh, to his will, soul and intellect is so stained by sin and corrupt that it cannot please God.

To remedy this condition, the adherent argues that God effectually regenerates his elect, giving them a new heart, new mind, the gift of faith and the ability to understand spiritual truth - specifically, only those truths He determined for them to understand. Other adherents of the doctrine claim God uses prevenient grace which makes people able to freely accept or reject God and spiritual truths.

There are numerous Biblical, Christological, Historical and Epistemological problems that arise. The latter is the focus for the lyrics of this song.

The Dilemma: 
If you are created with faculties that cannot rightly understand spiritual truth, or respond positively to God, this negates the utilization of your God given faculties to reason and consider such truths. Consequently, you would be unable to have any confidence that you've actually been regenerated, as regeneration is itself a spiritual truth you were created unable to rightly understand.

So orthodox Christians reject Total Depravity and instead historically have affirmed that as a result of Adam's sin, mankind is mortal, subject to suffering and death, born into a sinful world which besets us, tempting and deceiving us, and we go astray into sin and rebellion - becoming sinful and guilty. We are created with God-given faculties of reason, so that we can interact with and consider truth. As God says in the Scriptures "Come, let us reason together..." So we can recognize our personal sins and guilt, repent, and KNOW we will be forgiven and restored by a gracious God who made us in His image and likeness, and wants ALL to be saved.

title: Geneva Town - Calvin vs Servetus
description:
The tale of John Calvin (Jehan Cauvin) and Michael Servetus (Miguel Serveto) is pretty well-known among Christians and non-Christians alike. Controversy still swirls around the incident, with many critics of Calvinism claiming John Calvin murdered Servetus, while some Calvinists deny this charge, claim it was the State that executed him, or even argue heretics deserve death - while others in the Reformed Churches recognize the execution was unjust. In fact, in 1903 a committee from the Reformed Churches set up a granite monument to Servetus at the place of his death, stating:

"Respectful and grateful sons of Calvin, our great Reformer, but condemning an error which belonged to his century and firm believers in freedom of conscience according to the true principles of the Reformation and the Gospel, we have raised this expiatory monument."

But not all Calvinists are convicted thusly, as many call for Theonomy and a State run by the Church, with a desire to follow Calvin's strict totalitarian example.

7 Years Before the Execution, Calvin wrote:
"If he [Servetus] comes [to Geneva], I shall never let him go out alive if my authority has weight."

During the Incident, Calvin wrote:
"We have now new business in hand with Servetus. He intended perhaps passing through this city; for it is not yet known with what design he came. But after he had been recognized, I thought that he should be detained. My friend Nicolas summoned him on a capital charge. I hope that sentence of death will at least be passed upon him"

After the Execution:
"Many people have accused me of such ferocious cruelty that (they allege) I would like to kill again the man I have destroyed. Not only am I indifferent to their comments, but I rejoice in the fact that they spit in my face."

"Whoever shall now contend that it is unjust to put heretics and blasphemers to death will knowingly and willingly incur their very guilt.

Related:
Calvin was so strict and stern, he preached that rebellious children should be executed, calling them monsters, and crafting laws to this effect. Consequently, not only were men and women frequently starved, beaten, maimed and executed in Geneva, but so too were children deemed to be rebellious. Thus, Calvin's defenders seem to ignore his other sins, in frequent appeal to the State authorities involvement in the matter. Yet, these apologists overlook the depth of involvement Calvin had is both crafting the laws and enforcing them.

While the song has the line "Where even the devil dared not go", it is more accurate to say "Where the devil was not needed, for Geneva had its very own."

Geneva is to Calvinism, what the Mountain Meadows Massacre is to Mormonism... that is to say a manifestation of the rotten fruit of false teaching, which is frequently suppressed and dismissed by their followers.

title: Quiet Time - TULIP
description:
Have you ever begun a Bible study only to struggle to understand what the text is saying, as it seems to conflict with something else you believe to be true? This is often due to presupposing an extra-Biblical systematic or presupposition onto the text. It can be very difficult to set aside such things and just let Scripture speak. 

As we live in a culture permeated with Augustinian anthropology and Western Christian values, we often pick up beliefs by a form of osmosis, rather than disciplined study and thoughtful consideration. 

We often hear "I didn't become a Calvinist reading John Calvin. I just read my Bible." But with respect to our Calvinist brothers and sisters, they were indoctrinated into Calvinism, without having to read such things, as they listened and believed others who did so. You don't need to listen to John MacArthur, RC Sproul or James White, when you have a friend, family member or local pastor indoctrinating you into Calvinism.

LYRICS:

[Intro]
I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with my Bible
I used to think that it was so reliable.
What is wrong with me?
Why can‚Äôt I read, why can‚Äôt I read my Bible?


[Verse]
Woke up this morning for a quiet time
Coffee, comfy shirt and some sunshine.
As the sun rose it dawned on me
I replaced Scripture with Reformed Theology


[Chorus]
Reformed Theology is now all I can see
The systematic is organized so neatly
T-U-L-I-P is all I need
So I‚Äôll just read that into my Bible, my Bible


[Verse 2]
When I learned about the doctrines of Grace
I was sick to my stomach, offended and ashamed.
But over time, my senses wore down
I surrendered my thoughts to the Reformed crowd


[Verse]
I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with my Bible
I used to think that it was so reliable.
What is wrong with me?
Why can‚Äôt I read, why can‚Äôt I read my Bible?


[Verse]
He said you have eyes but do not see
Could He possibly be speaking of me?
I overlay the text with an assumption
But what justifies such a presumption?


[Chorus]
Reformed Theology is now all I can see
The systematic is organized so neatly
T-U-L-I-P is all I need
So I‚Äôll just read that into my Bible, my Bible

title: Vipers (in diapers)

To be clear, not all Calvinists make such wilds claims to say God decreed all sin and evil to obtain, or that God damns infants to eternal torment. But some Calvinists do make these claims... Calvinists like James White of @AominOrg hold that due to being "in Adam" when Adam sinned, we are born guilty, spiritually dead and under God's wrath... that before God created the world, He decreed all sin and evil to obtain with specificity, and determined to only save some, the elect. Meanwhile the unelect, are eternally without hope. James White affirms there are unelect adults and infants.

While these are disgusting beliefs and claims, they're the result of a consistent application of Reformed Theology and Augustinian anthropology (Total Depravity and Original Sin). Of course, we reject these teachings as they're contrary to Scripture and the early Church. For more on that check out our video on Total Depravity: https://www.youtube.com/live/TgfpaTMjgUw?si=OK-Q67t6zC8CJoUg

Far too many grieving parents have been told they can't trust God not to cast their deceased infant or young child into hell. This is spiritual, emotional and psychological abuse. God is good. title: The Passion of the Christ - 20 Year Anniversary Review
description:
The Passion of the Christ was released on February 25, 2004 - marking this its 20th anniversary. As of 2023, the film is the highest grossing R-Rated film and the highest grossing Christian film (box office adjusted). It has seen its share of controversy over the years, chiefly centered on its portrayal of the brutality Christ suffered.

Paul Vendredi joins Warren McGrew of Idol Killer in this review to consider the film's portrayal of Jesus' suffering, its underlying Anselmian Atonement Theories, contrasting this with historic depictions in various paintings and iconography, as well as other portrayals in film such as Ben Hur, and we consider its impact on Christian filmmaking and the culture at large.

Paul Vendredi is a conservative Christian podcaster following the Eastern Orthodox tradition. Paul focuses his attention on theories of the Atonement with side interests in the counter-cult movement and patristics. Paul's podcast can be found at PaulVendredi.com. Paul also runs the YouTube channel @ChristianTheologicalArchive  which preserves out-of-print audio and video recordings on Christian topics.

If you're interested in learning how the Work of Christ has been understood by Christians since the early Church, or are interested in our critique of Penal Substitution, check out our playlist on this topic for more.

#moviereview #christian #ThePassionofTheChrist #Atonement

title: A Calvinist View of Infants
description:
What happens to infants and young children that sadly pass away? Scripture tells us they go to be with the God who lovingly created them. However, some Augustinians (Calvinists, Catholics & Arminians) hold to the doctrine of infant damnation.

Recently, Warren McGrew of Idol Killer went on @Soteriology101  with Leighton Flowers and Jordan Hatfield of @GreatLightStudios . There the topic of unelect children perishing came up, and Warren described the spirit behind it as being akin to those ancient pagan worshippers of Molech and Baal. #BaalGate 

Well, some Calvinists (like James White of @AominOrg  & Marlon Wilson of @tgtengage  and others) didn't take this too kindly. However, instead of offering a Biblical or philosophical defense of the doctrine, they clutched their pearls, called Warren a liar, claimed he rejected Scripture and twisted the Bible, told people he claimed Calvinists don't love their children and overall presented this as if Warren claimed all Calvinists affirmed infant damnation. Yet, anyone familiar with either the context of Warren's statements, or his teaching elsewhere should know - Warren has never argued this is monolithic. 

But nevertheless, Christians across the internet began locking horns over infant damnation, as well as these misrepresentations. Some going so far as to demand Warren apologize, calling his statements a personal attack.

"Yes, I believe your babies go to heaven. No, I'm not the least bit sorry."

Eventually Warren, Leighton and Jordan met back up to offer a response, but this video should suffice as a highlight of the firestorm Warren's comments ignited.

title: Problems with Divine Simplicity? Yes!
description:
Recently, Dr. Gavin Ortlund of @TruthUnites released a video entitled "Why Believe in Divine Simplicity?" where he offered three reasons in 5 minutes. Several viewers reached out, asking for my thoughts on the matter. So I brought on Dr. Ryan Mullins and Dr. Alan Rhoda to respond to Gavin's video with me.

Divine Simplicity is the doctrine that all of God's attributes and actions are identical to God. As you will see, there are some major issues with Divine Simplicity that are so severe that Christians should not affirm it.

This being said, we like Gavin and our response is in no way intended to be mean spirited, but rather just a friendly in-house discussion among Christian brothers.

title: The Gospel of Inclusion VS Christian Inclusivism
description:
As we reflect on the birth and Work of Christ, how should we understand His salvific triumph? 

Matt and Billy of @BibleBrodown join Idol Killer to compare and contrast Christian Inclusivism with Carlton Pearson's "Gospel of Inclusion" (aka universalism or pluralism). Pearson taught everyone is saved and going to heaven; that no one need repent of sin or change their lives to be in keeping with some divine standard. Whereas Christian Inclusivism teaches God has made a way for all people, through Christ - that no one is saved apart from Him, and yes, not everyone will be saved.

While the terms sound similar, the so-called "Gospel of Inclusion" and Christian Inclusivism are very different beliefs. Pearson jettisoned the Bible, arguing it was flawed writings of men about God; while Inclusivists affirm Scripture is Inspired by God Himself (2 Timothy 3:16-17).

#Universalism #inclusion #inclusive #christian

title: How to Pray like an Honest Calvinist
description:
Somewhere outside the city of Geneva, on Earth 1689, it happened that a Calvinist Theologian was praying, and when he had finished, one of his disciples said to him, ‚ÄúPastor, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.‚Äù and he said to them: 

"Oh Sovereign God, whom from all eternity, freely and unchangeably ordained whatsoever comes to pass, I thank you... I know you bring about all things in accordance with your will,... I know the evils of this world have NOT arisen by your mere permission, (or as a result of your patient call to repentance), but that YOU yourself bring about all evils for your glory and good pleasure,... I thank you for bringing evil into the world. I thank you for the brutality at Birkenau and at Auschwitz. I thank you for the terrible killings of Dennis Rader. I thank you for the brutality of war, and the countless widows and orphans it creates. I thank you for the perverse abuse of young children. I know these evil men were perfectly obeying your Sovereign will. I thank you. I see your gracious hand in the hurts others do to me, (like the Ford Focus that cut me off at the light this afternoon). I thank you. I thank you for my wife, and the abuse she inflicts upon our children while I‚Äôm away from the home. I know you did this to build mine and my children‚Äôs character. I thank you that its only been bruises and bloody noses. I know you saw fit to have my boss fire me from my job, during the holiday season, just as I know it was your Sovereign will that he hire Stephanie this past Spring and that we have an affair. I thank you for giving me an irresistible desire for red heads. Above all, I know it was your Sovereign hand keeping my wife ignorant of our illicit love making, (during our lunch break at the motel six). I thank you. I know that it was your perfect will that my neighbor got drunk and took his own life this morning, just as it was your perfect will that I was distracted on my cell phone and backed the car over his son last week. I thank you. I know you've regenerated me and elected me unto salvation, and while I'm unsure about my wife and children's eternal destiny, I thank you. Please bless this food to the nourishment of our bodies and bless the hands that prepared it, or don't. Whatever your Sovereign will is. Thank you, and amen!‚Äù

#calvinism #satire #parody 

In this video we learn how to pray like an Honest Calvinist from men like John MacArthur of@gracetoyou RC Sproul of @ligonier James White of @AominOrg Voddie Baucham of@gfbc1689 and others.

title: Anabaptist Balthasar Hubmaier - Freedom of the Will
description:
Balthasar Hubmaier (1480‚Äì1528) was an influential German Anabaptist leader and one of the most well-known and respected Anabaptist theologians of the Reformation.

In the closing of his work entitled "Freedom of the Will" he laid out a very strong argument against theistic determinism and fatalism which are the undercurrent of Augustinian philosophy and Calvinist "Sovereignty".

Both he and his wife were seized by the Austrian authorities and taken to Vienna. 


"I may err ‚Äì I am a man," he wrote, "but a heretic I cannot be, because I ask constantly for instruction in the word of God."

He suffered torture on the rack, and was tried for heresy and convicted. On 10 March 1528, he was taken to the public square and executed by burning. His wife exhorted him to remain steadfast. Three days after his execution, his wife, with a stone tied around her neck, was drowned in the River Danube.

Imagine being martyred because you refuse to blame God for your sin and unrepentance, preferring instead to confess your blameworthiness. Or consider why the Reformers and Roman Catholics would be so enraged to the point of putting people to death for such a thing.

Roman Catholics and Reformed Protestants despised and persecuted the Anabaptists, all the while remarking about how resentful and frustrated they were with the fruit of the Spirit and transformed lives these Anabaptists demonstrated.

#Anabaptist #ChurchHistory #Reformation

title: Why Respond to Mike Winger on PSA?
description:
Across his six videos defending PSA and criticizing those who don't affirm this doctrine, Mike made some pretty charged comments. As he perceives PSA as the heart of Christianity and the Gospel, he received challenges to this doctrine as though they were challenging the Work of Christ itself.

Thus, Mike placed critics of PSA into two categories: lying, liberal, progressive, poop-faces who have stripped away the true meaning of the cross in an effort to create a god in their own image and deceive others in the process... or those who have been deceived and are too ignorant to accept PSA and should have just trusted their Bible. 

This brief video is intended to highlight some of Mike's statements, so we are not accused of inventing these out of thin air. Yes, there is a context in which he said these things and you can watch his entire series via the links provided below and determine for yourself the merit of Mike's claims and ours.

We do not view PSA as a litmus test to determine who is a Christian and who isn't. We do have strong reasons for rejecting the doctrine, as we discussed in our 15 Part series responding to him.

We are conservative, Bible believing Christians who respect Christian history. As noted in our response series, we love and appreciate Mike and his ministry. This is just one of those areas where we must disagree.

#PenalSubstitution #Atonement #MikeWinger

title: Is God unjust? - Answering Mike Winger E15
description:
Episode 15/15

Does Penal Substitutionary Atonement portray God as unjust? Yes. Yes, it does. However, Mike Winger has produced six videos in defense of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA), claiming there is no such injustice in PSA; it is perfectly acceptable for the innocent to be punished in the place of the guilty.  

In this episode we provide quotes from @MikeWinger, as well as clips & quotes from various theologians and individuals such as William Lane Craig @ReasonableFaithOrg, John Dominic Crossan, Wayne Grudem, Walter Martin, Worley Oscar Vaught, James White @AominOrg, James MacDonald, Hank Hanegraaff, Edwin Barnhart, Marshall Eakin; demonstrating that Penal Substitution is not Biblical nor an essential doctrine of the Christian faith.

This series of videos intends to offer a respectful response & counter-argument to the claims Mike has made. It is our contention that he is the one who is engaging in historical revisionism, & an anachronistic handling of the materials. Though, we do not believe he is doing so intentionally, but rather the result of a bias which has left him far from objective.

"Does Penal Substitution make God unjust?" The Biblical answer is an emphatic, "Yes!"

#PenalSubstitution #Atonement #MikeWinger

In this episode we provide clips & quotes from Mike, as well as numerous passages from Scripture, a clip from Jerry Falwell and we quote ancient Christian writings like the Didascalia Apostolorum & Epistle of Barnabas; demonstrating the problems with Penal Substitutionary Atonement.

title: Isaiah 53, God's Love & Healing - Answering Mike Winger E12
description:
Episode 12/15

Moving forward responding to @MikeWinger's claims regarding Penal Substitution, we take a deep dive into Isaiah 53 - a favorite prooftext of the Atonement School. Here we show why Isaiah 53 does NOT teach Penal Substitution (PSA).

title: God's Wrath in PSA - Answering Mike Winger E10
description:
Episode 10/15 

In this episode, we consider how God's wrath is viewed in Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA), versus Mike Winger's portrayal of it.

Across six videos (as of this recording) Mike has argued that Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA) does not entail a split in the Trinity, or hold that God hates us, or that Jesus saves us from God, or that God murdered His Son. However, as we document here, that is precisely what PSA entails. 

@MikeWinger seemingly is rejecting several entailments of PSA, while simultaneously seeking to affirm and maintain it as a cohesive model. Yet, after amputating so many aspects of PSA, can it still be said that Mike is actually affirming PSA and not forming some new Atonement theory?

title: The Pagan Parallels of PSA - Answering Mike Winger E9
description:
Episode 9/15

In this, our 9th Episode responding to claims Mike Winger has made regarding Penal Substitution, we consider PSA's Pagan parallels.

Mike has argued that Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA) isn't like pagan human sacrifice, as the victim (Jesus) goes willingly. However, here we point out this is actually common among pagan human sacrificial systems. We also explore the parallels in more detail, noting the problems with the claims Mike Winger made.

It is our contention the passages of Scripture @MikeWinger & the Early Church Fathers he references do NOT teach PSA. With respect to Mike, despite his claims that is it our side engaging in historical revisionism & an anachronistic handling of the materials, we believe he is guilty of this very thing. Though, we believe he is likely doing so unintentionally, as the result of a bias which has left him far from objective.

title: Fallacious Foundations of PSA - Answering Mike Winger E8
description:
Episode 8/15

Continuing response to Mike Winger's claims regarding Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA), we consider his fallacious arguments. The fallacy of hypostatized proof (Reification) is when an abstraction is treated as though it were the event itself. This episode seeks to demonstrate Mike Winger's repeated reliance upon such fallacious reasoning.

To date, Mike has produced six lengthy videos defending PSA while simultaneously claiming Christians who do not accept his Atonement Theory do so by way of misrepresenting the facts, engaging in historical revisionism & teaching unBiblical views of how we are saved. He insists PSA is the heart of Christianity and the Gospel. 

With respect to @MikeWinger, it is our contention that he is the one who is engaging in historical revisionism, & an anachronistic handling of the materials. Though, we do not believe he is doing so intentionally, but rather the result of a bias which has left him far from objective.

In this episode we provide several quotes from Mike, as well as a clip from James White @AominOrg and numerous passages of Scripture.

"Is Penal Substitution True?" The answer is clearly, "No!"

In our continuing response to Mike Winger's defense of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA), we consider the ways in which he engages in forestalling disagreement. The Forestalling Disagreement Fallacy occurs when tactics are used to make raising an objection seem to be contrarian or otherwise embarrassing, and thus to try to keep others from disagreeing.

Across six videos, Mike has sought to defend PSA while simultaneously claiming Christians who reject PSA do so by way of misrepresenting the facts, engaging in historical revisionism & teaching unBiblical views of how we are saved. He insists PSA is the heart of Christianity and the Gospel. 

With respect to @MikeWinger, it is our contention that he is the one who is engaging in historical revisionism, & an anachronistic handling of the materials. Though, we do not believe he is doing so intentionally, but rather the result of a bias which has left him far from objective.

title: What The Church Fathers Taught on PSA - Answering Mike Winger E2
description:
Episode 2/15 

Mike produced 6 videos on Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA), claiming Christian leaders who reject Penal Substitution do so by way of misrepresenting the facts, engaging in historical revisionism & teaching unBiblical views of how we are saved. To defend his claims he quotes from various sources, such as Scripture & early Christians. 

In this episode we provide quotes from @MikeWinger, as well as clips & quotes from various theologians such as James White @AominOrg, John MacArthur @gracetoyou, Tim Keller, Wayne Grudem, Walter Martin, Athanasios S. Frangopoulos & John Calvin. We also spend considerable time examining Early Church Fathers such as Cyril of Jerusalem, John of Damascus, Gregory of Nazianzus & Basil of Caesarea; demonstrating that PSA is a later development & not an essential doctrine of the Christian faith.

This series of videos intends to offer a respectful response & counter-argument to the claims Mike has made. It is our contention that he is the one who is engaging in historical revisionism, & an anachronistic handling of the materials. Though, we do not believe he is doing so intentionally, but rather the result of a bias which has left him far from objective.

"Do the Early Church Fathers Teach Penal Substitution?" The answer is a resounding, "No!"

#PenalSubstitution #Atonement #MikeWinger

title: God's Knowledge of the Future
description:
How should we understand God's knowledge of and relationship to future events? Chris Fisher of @realityisnotoptional joins Idol Killer to discuss various models and specifically a recent Idol Killer community post:

Question: 
Does God know what horse will you ride three days before Thanksgiving 2028?

Solution 1. 
God from all eternity determined you to ride the Palomino, so He will effectually bring it to pass. Thus, He knows what you will do, because He will ensure you do it.

Solution 2. 
God created all time and actions such that sequence is an illusion; past, present and future are all equal existing realities. As such a temporal counterpart of yourself has always ridden the Appaloosa. God knows this, because He created it this way. The you reading this right now, will never ride the Appaloosa, but your temporal counterpart is forever.

Solution 3. 
God looked at all possible worlds and for some reason really wanted to actualize the world where you will certainly ride a Thoroughbred. In another world you could've ridden any other horse, or chosen not to ride a horse, but in this world you will always choose to ride the Thoroughbred because God determined you to when He created this world.

Solution 4.
Yes, God knows what horse you will ride or won't. We don't know how or why, and we don't like to consider all the problems this claim creates, like seemingly entailing all things obtain necessarily due to God's perfect knowledge of settled future events. We appeal to mystery.

Solution 5. 
The matter of if you will or won't ride a horse is as of yet indeterminate. Why must you ride a horse 3 days before Thanksgiving 2028? God hasn't created it as an existing reality equal to past and present, nor has He effectually decreed it to obtain and committed Himself to bringing it to pass, nor have you determined to ride a horse, nor is the future so linear that it is inevitable you will ride a horse. Neither the past nor the future exist. When the matter is settled, God will know this perfectly because His knowledge of reality is perfect... until then He knows this as indeterminate, because again His knowledge of reality is perfect.

#Foreknowledge #Omniscience #Christianity 

If you're interested in the various views of Divine Foreknowledge and would like to learn more, consider the following resources:

https://amzn.to/3oLuMlK

https://amzn.to/3IUqU8K

title: Omnipotence or Amipotence? - Thomas Oord & Ryan Mullins
description:
Omnipotence is dead.

At least according to a recent argument put forward by Thomas J Oord in his latest book the Death of Omnipotence and the Birth of Amipotence.

There, Oord argues Omnipotence has no biblical support, dying a death of a thousand qualifications in philosophy. Further Oord points to the problem of pain and evil as reasons to reject Omnipotence. However, he argues the death of omnipotence is not the death of God.

Joining Idol Killer to discuss the concept and claims surrounding Oord's views on Amipotence is none other than Thomas J Oord and Ryan Mullins.

Thomas Jay Oord, Ph.D., is a theologian, philosopher, and scholar of multi-disciplinary studies. Oord directs the Center for Open and Relational Theology and doctoral students at Northwind Theological Seminary. He is an award-winning author and has written or edited more than thirty books. A gifted speaker, Oord lectures at universities, conferences, churches, and institutions. He is known for his contributions to research on love, science and religion, open and relational theology, the problem of suffering, and the implications of freedom for transformational relationships. ‚úàÔ∏è Visit his website: thomasjayoord.com

üìö The Death of Omnipotence and Birth of Amipotence
https://amzn.to/3pmPLuW
(Idol Killer receives a small commission on purchases which use the above links.)

R.T. Mullins, PhD., has published over 30 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. He has published two books, The End of the Timeless God (Oxford University Press, 2016) and God and Emotion (Cambridge University Press, 2020). Mullins has held research and teaching fellowships at the University of Notre Dame, the University of Cambridge, the University of St Andrews, and the University of Edinburgh. He has now joined Helsinki Collegium for Advanced Studies, University of Helsinki (Finland). ‚úàÔ∏è Visit his website: rtmullins.com

#Religion #philosophy #amipotence

title: Paul Washer on Totally Depraved Babies - Kind of
description:
You didn't have to teach your children to lie did you? Did you have to teach them how to army crawl? To properly load & fire a rifle? Did you have to teach them to steal? To jump out of planes behind enemy lines, to set up a perimeter, to keep their feet dry? Of course not, they're totally depraved!

Paul Washer is known for his views on "evil babies" and defending the Calvinist Doctrine of Total Depravity. This video comes by way of a special request from a viewer... yes, it is a parody... yes it mocks that horrendous doctrine of Total Depravity.

We hope you got a chuckle out of it.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Washer's original quote:

Imagine for a moment an 18-month old baby that you are holding in your arms, and that 18-month old baby sees that shining watch on your wrist, and he grabs for your watch, and you pull his hand away and say, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù He begins to cry and move about in your arms. He reaches for the watch again, you grab his hand and say, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù He begins to scream and cry. He reaches for the watch again, you say, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù He begins to flail his arms even in the direction of your face. I submit to you that if that 18-month old baby had the strength of an 18-year old man, he would slaughter you there where you stand, father, rip the watch off your arm and walk across your bloody body, out the door without feeling an ounce of remorse. 

You see, here is something you need to understand: Hitler was not an anomaly. Hitler was not a phenomenon. Hitler was what everyone in this room has the potential of being. And not only that, you need to understand, even in all the wickedness of Hitler, Hitler was still restrained by the common grace of God. And you need to know this, that if it were not for the common grace of God restraining you in your unconverted state, you would make Hitler look like a choir boy. What we do not understand is what Scripture teaches about men: Men are evil. 

You say, ‚ÄúWell I don‚Äôt agree.‚Äù That‚Äôs because you‚Äôve grabbed enough of Christianity to stand, but you don‚Äôt believe the Bible. The Scripture‚Äôs testimony against you, and all men, is that we are born with evil, and we are evil. Do you have to teach a child to lie? Do you have to teach a child to be self-centered? Do you have to teach a child to be selfish? Do you have to teach a child to be brutal to other children? They learn that on their own. Set them free, discipline them not, and see what you have in 10 years ‚Äì a monster. Why? Because what Scripture says is true. And you hold your ears and you say, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to hear it! I don‚Äôt want to hear it!‚Äù In the same way that a person dying of cancer is in denial and says to the doctor, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to hear it! I don‚Äôt want to hear it!‚Äù That by cupping the hands over your ears, you close yourself off from any remedy.

The first thing you must embrace is this: All men are born in sin, and given over to sin; and all men are born hating God.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#PaulWasher #TotalDepravity #Calvinism

title: Who the Heck was Augustine of Hippo? #shorts
description:
WHO THE HECK WAS AUGUSTINE OF HIPPO?

Both Roman Catholicism and Reformed Protestantism stand on the foundation of Augustinian anthropology and philosophy. So who was Augustine, what did he believe and why did he have a pet hippo?

Augustine was a former Manichean convert to Christianity. Regrettably, he let his his former Manichean beliefs influence his understanding of Scripture, filtering it through his neo-Platonist philosophical commitment. He built upon pre-existing errors, tweaking and repackaging them into what would come to be known as the doctrine of Original Sin.

A summary of some of his more outlandish beliefs:

1. Unbaptized infants go to hell due to Adam's sin, but it isn't as hot for them as it is for adults; though some baptized infants also go to hell.

2. Being intimate with your wife for pleasure is worse than with a "lady of the night".

3. The use of violence to force conversion to Christianity is acceptable.

4. The use of contraception in marriage is adultery.

5. Only those trained in the sciences approved by Augustine should be allowed to teach theology.

Augustine's influence on Christianity cannot be understated. Want to know more about this man some revere as a Saint and others see as a Whack-a-doodle?

title: Let's Talk About Original Sin & Total Depravity
description:
DOES THE BIBLE TEACH ORIGINAL SIN AND TOTAL DEPRAVITY?

Anyone familiar with the channel will know Idol Killer believes the Bible stands in opposition to Augustinian anthropology. Warren has engaged in moderated debates on the topic, such as the one with Matt Slick and Idol Killer has an ongoing series presenting a Biblical and reasoned critique of these doctrines.

However, sometimes its good to just engage in a discussion of the topic. What are the consequences of affirming these doctrines, or denying them? What about various passages in Scripture that Augustinians claim teach these things? How does OS & TD impact the way we raise our children, see ourselves and impact our view of the future?

This video will be rather informal, and far from exhaustive, but hopefully it will help answer your questions and give you another perspective to consider as you pursue Christ in truth.

title: The Apostasy of Tyler Vela
description:
TYLER VELA RENOUNCES CHRIST

Recently Calvinist YouTuber and Podcaster, Tyler Vela of @TheFreedThinkerPodcast publicly renounced his faith in Christ. As regular viewers of this channel are aware, Warren and Tyler have often disagreed and locked horns in online and formal debate.

To be crystal clear, in no way should this video be seen as dunking on Tyler or celebrating his walking away from Christianity. Rather, this is somewhat of a sympathetic rebuke and encouragement for him.

This video is NOT calling Tyler to return to the god of neo-Platonism... he‚Äôs clearly still following him. This is NOT calling Tyler to return to god as he understood Him in Calvinism. Rather, this video is calling Tyler to consider the reason he cried out to God for comfort in the first place; that this innate need for a transcendent comfort points to a transcendent Comforter... Tyler's need for transcendent love points to a transcendent Lover‚Ä¶ not a static, unfeeling, un-relational concept as he's experienced in neo-Platonism.

Tyler‚Äôs admitted need for comfort shows he was looking in the wrong place - not that it was wrong to look‚Ä¶ not that it was wrong to realize that place was empty‚Ä¶ but an encouragement to keep looking.


Tyler called the God presented in the Bible, absent neo-Platonism, a Hebraic Mega-Zeus and that may be a cute or effective form of rhetoric for some, but this video is an invitation for Tyler to ponder is how comforted David was by this God when he lost his child‚Ä¶ How Jesus came because of God‚Äôs love for the world‚Ä¶ to consider the care with which God clothed Adam and Eve after they introduced sin, suffering and death by their rebellion‚Ä¶ to consider the early martyrs who sang while being burned alive and devoured by lions‚Ä¶ to consider the Living and relational God of the Bible does indeed comfort‚Ä¶ unlike the god he found wanting.


I love you Tyler‚Ä¶ I disagree with you now, as I have previously‚Ä¶ but God is better than the both of us‚Ä¶ and I pray you come to know Him in a truly profound way.


Ya‚Äôll lift this man up in prayer‚Ä¶ God bless.


#TylerVela #Deconversion #Apostasy

title: Responding to Mr. Fortenberry - A Criticism of Open Theism
description:
RESPONDING TO BILL FORTENBERRY'S CRITICISM OF IDOL KILLER'S VIDEO ON IS OPEN THEISM ATHEISM

Bill Fortenberry, a Christian philosopher and historian, recently posted a review critical of a video response Idol Killer made to Anthony Rogers.

Watch that video here:  https://youtu.be/eJGfKgNhVXc

To be fair to Mr. Fortenberry, he seemingly did not share Mr. Rogers' view that Open Theism is a form of atheism. Some of Mr. Fortenberry's criticism was unjustified, some understandable, and some even deserved. For instance, in his article Mr. Fortenberry attacked the video's production quality and content:

"The video is difficult to watch. It is an amateurish conglomeration of clips, texts, and sounds with very little consistency." Bill Fortenberry

So clearly not all of Mr. Fortenberry's criticism was unfounded. The video most certainly is, and rather unashamedly so, amateurish and difficult to watch... we claim this was intentional and simply call it our "style".

Regardless, there were some points of criticism that were in error, so Dr. Alan Rhoda came on the program to respond. This seemed fair, as in his article Mr. Fortenberry criticized comments Dr. Rhoda made in the Idol Killer video. 

Not surprisingly, at points Dr. Rhoda agreed with Mr. Fortenberry that Warren's comments were imprecise, brutish and needed refinement. Nevertheless, Dr. Rhoda did note several points made by Mr. Fortenberry were simply in error.

For more from Dr. Rhoda, visit his blog:  http://www.alanrhoda.net 

This video is intended to be a somewhat lighthearted response to the claims and challenges made by Bill Fortenberry, and certainly not meanspirited. Like our poor production quality, our sense of humor is amateurish and difficult to understand... and for the record, Warren is the cute one. We know this because he tells himself this in the mirror twenty times every morning.

To read Mr. Fortenberry's article in full:  http://www.increasinglearning.com/blog/open-theism-video?fbclid=IwAR0Xjjh_w6od8mSvf4NtnrM_eSq2tS3gqQYjNx5KkqJElTTrzHguYB2eXdw

title: Darrell Brooks Appeals to Theistic Determinism
description:
DARRELL BROOKS SUGGESTS GOD CAUSED HIS ACTIONS

Darrell Brooks was charged with six counts of first-degree intentional homicide and 71 other counts due to driving his SUV into the Waukesha Christmas Parade on Nov. 21, 2021. After rejecting council and electing to defend himself in court, on October 26. 2022, the jury found him guilty of the charges against him.

In this brief video, we analyze comments he made during his closing remarks, suggesting this was all due to God's will, and how this view of Theistic Determinism helped him shift the burden of his actions from himself onto God.

Theistic Determinism is the view that God determines every event that occurs in the history of the world. While many Christians hold to such a view, it is essential this be pointed out... Theistic Determinism is NOT in keeping with Christian Orthodoxy and is a variation of fatalism. While God does intervene at times, directing the course of human history, it is false to assert He has effectually decreed whatsoever comes to pass. Rather, God formed man in His image and likeness and bestowed upon him the gift of self-determination.

As we see in this brief video, Theistic Determinism allows one to shift the guilt of their actions from themselves onto God. Perpetrators of evil are held accountable precisely because they were free and capable of doing other than what they did.

Lives were lost and people suffered due to the free actions Darrell Brooks took. He and he alone is guilty for the evil he perpetrated.

#darrellbrooks #trial #waukesha

title: Love as Proof of God's Existence
description:
THE UNIVERSAL NEED FOR LOVE SERVES AS EVIDENCE FOR GOD'S EXISTENCE, INFORMING US ABOUT WHO HE IS.

In this brief video, we discuss how love is essential for human flourishing - how love is transcendent and points us to a transcendent lover: God.

It's a sad thing to go through life unloved and unappreciated. At times our parents, siblings, friends, significant other - they fail to love or appreciate us. To be fair, we can be guilty of the same.

Yet, something in each of us deeply desires to love and be known... to love and to know the heart of another.

Love is just as important to human flourishing as clean water, shelter, healthy food and healthcare. It's a universal need. 

Yet, love is transcendent. Like consciousness, love is beyond the material universe. I am convinced that our transcendent need for love is evidence of a transcendent lover. God.

Such a thing merely serves as a reason, a marker - pointing us to God. However, it also reveals something about the nature of God as well: that He made us to love and be loved, that He is relational.

So it seems to me that understanding love is a good starting point in coming to know the heart of God.

Now critics will point to differing conceptions of love or the fickle nature of hormones and chemical reactions, drawing us back to the material world, failing to address the transcendent nature of love.

Human love can fail. This isn't in dispute. After all, this was my starting point. However, the universal need for transcendent love calls us to direct our hearts homeward... to recognize we are loved and to properly direct our love to He who will not fail.

"Love is patient, love is kind, it is not jealous; love does not brag, it is not arrogant. It does not act disgracefully, it does not seek its own benefit; it is not provoked, does not keep an account of a wrong suffered, it does not rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth; it keeps every confidence, it believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. Love never fails..." 1 Corinthians 13:4‚Ä≠-‚Ä¨8

So tell us about this loving God!

‚ÄúFor God so loved the world, that He gave His only Son, so that everyone who believes in Him will not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but so that the world might be saved through Him." John 3:16‚Ä≠-‚Ä¨17

In the Bible Jesus tells us the greatest commandment is to love God... and the second is like this - to love others.

Or to quote to Smiths...

"I am human and I need to be loved
Just like everybody else does..."

#GodisLove #WhatisLove #Christianity

title: Divine Providence & the Problem of Evil - 4 Views
description:
ALAN RHODA DISCUSSES THE PROBLEM OF EVIL AND DIVINE PROVIDENCE

Dr Alan Rhoda, academic librarian and Christian philosopher joins Idol Killer to discuss the Problem of Evil in light of four views of Divine Providence (Calvinism, Molinism, Open Theism & Process Theism). He‚Äôs earned dual Master‚Äôs degrees from the University of Bloomington, has taught philosophy at various institutions such as the University of Notre Dame and the University of Nevada. The main focus of his research has been on the openness of the future as contrasted with the settled nature of the past and present; publishing over a dozen papers, exploring different ways the open view can be understood.

The main focus of our conversation is Dr Rhoda's paper entitled: "Retrospective and Prospective Problems of Evil: A Comparative Assessment of Four Models of Divine Providence."

In this paper he considers how each of the four views fair when considering the Retrospective and Prospective problems of evil.

title: What is Open Theism? What does it mean?
description:
ANTHONY ROGERS CLAIMS OPEN THEISM IS ATHEISM.

There are a lot of bad claims about what Open Theism is and what it entails. @Ousias1 is a perfect example of false claims and bad arguments against the position. 

In this brief video, some of Anthony's claims are addressed while also providing a concise summary of what Open Theism is contrasted with Closed Theism. Anthony put forward several claims, begging the question for fatalism and the settled future, arguing this IS the Christian view and all views entailing an Open premise are damnable heresy... and in doing so, he condemned his own tradition, Calvinism.

In this episode you'll hear from ACTUAL Open Theists like Greg Boyd, William Hasker and Alan Rhoda as well as respected Molinist philosopher Ryan Mullins as they lay out the unique claims of Open Theism.

This response intends to correct some really, REALLY, no good, super bad, terrible, odious and downright faulty criticism of the open position. For more in depth responses where Early Church Fathers and the Biblical arguments are considered, check out Idol Killer's 2 Part Response to Anthony:

title: Why You Should Affirm Dynamic Omniscience - Ryan Mullins
description:
WHY EVERYONE SHOULD AFFIRM DYNAMIC OMNISCIENCE WITH RYAN MULLINS

Ryan Mullins (PhD, University of St Andrews) joins Idol Killer to discuss why he believes Calvinists, Molinists, Open Theists - everyone - ought to affirm some kind of dynamic omniscience.

Ryan has published over 30 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. He has also published two books, üìö The End of the Timeless God (https://amzn.to/3wom1Og) and üìö God and Emotion (https://amzn.to/3Pri4km). Mullins has held research and teaching fellowships at the University of Notre Dame, the University of Cambridge, the University of St Andrews, and the University of Edinburgh. 

Listen to Ryan's Podcast, The Reluctant Theologian @ www.rtmullins.com/podcast

What is Dynamic Omniscience? How might DO help with Christian apologetics? What does it mean for God to think? What are the Biblical and philosophical arguments for DO? These and many other questions will be explored in this episode!

title: Consistent Calvinists DENY God's Foreknowledge & Predestination
description:
FOREKNOWLEDGE & PREDESTINATION ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH CALVINISM (OR CLASSICAL THEISM AT LARGE).

In this brief video, Anthony Rogers and Edward Dalcour both affirm that God lacks literal foreknowledge and has never literally predestined anything. This of course seemingly breaks the Calvinist's "Golden Chain of Redemption".

Why would they make such an assertion and hold to contradictory tenets? Because of their commitment to God being atemporal. They claim such terms are meaningless anthropomorphism wherein God condescends to the Biblical authors as they were less intelligent than the Platonists.

What does it mean to be atemporal, you ask? It means to be timeless... not merely eternal and without beginning or end, but lacking activity, sequence, absent any temporal location, duration or extension... static, frozen and immobile... completely unrelated to temporal events and the created realm. This concept arises not from Scripture, but Platonist philosophy. Rather, Scripture speaks of God in terms of endless time, or ages of ages, and affirms His sequential operations as it directly connects such things with Him being the Living God.

link to the full video: https://youtu.be/H-tuwfhEjIY

#foreknowledge #predestination #Calvinism

title: Anthony Rogers Cancels Last Minute & Runs From Debate
description:
ANTHONY ROGERS RUNS FROM DEBATE, WHILE NAME CALLING & LYING

In September of 2021, Anthony Rogers produced a video attacking all open (non-Fatalistic) positions as non-Christian. Specifically, Rogers attacked Dynamic Omniscience (DO). 

Warren McGrew of Idol Killer reached out to Anthony and offered to debate the topic with him, in an effort to set the record straight and demonstrate DO's place within Scripture and Christian orthodoxy. Initially, Anthony agreed and the debate was set for October... then January. One week prior to the debate Rogers canceled, asking that it be postponed. The debate host & moderator, Marlon Wilson w/ the Gospel Truth, then attempted to reschedule the debate. Dates in March and May were offered, but Rogers refused to respond or reschedule.

Recently, a viewer of Roger's program asked him if he intended to debate Warren. Rogers claimed to be busy and further attacked and lied about Warren, claiming he was rejecting Christ.

At no point has Warren rejected Christ. Rather, Warren has argued against fatalism. Anthony knows this, but finds it easier to call Warren a heretic, a Christ denier and other names than to actually engaged him in debate.

Will this debate ever take place? That's up to Anthony. He need only invest about 15 minutes to schedule it, should he be willing.

title: Debate Response - God Possesses Dynamic Omniscience
description:
TYLER VELA VS WARREN MCGREW DEBATE

Recently Warren McGrew of Idol Killer debated Tyler Vela of the Freed Thinker Podcast to debate whether or not God Possesses Dynamic Omniscience, meaning does God possess active awareness and complete knowledge based in a temporally present perception of reality?

Make Exegesis Great Again! 

For his part, Warren provided passages of Scripture showing God thinks, has intelligence and actively uses wisdom. However, Tyler argued God doesn't think; that accepting the depictions of God in Scripture as anything but analogical is to worship a Hebraic Mega-Zeus. So the Biblical support Warren provided was simply dismissed and not engaged. Warren also cited the statements of men like Clement of Rome, Polycarp, Ignatius and Aristides who all affirmed God's active omniscience and Tyler dismissed these as well. Warren provided philosophical arguments and here too, Tyler rejected them and instead chose to misrepresent Warren's view, attack strawmen and bring up irrelevant issues instead.

This video provides a brief overview of all this and addresses some misrepresentations and misunderstandings in an attempt to set the record straight.

WHAT IS DYNAMIC OMNISCIENCE?

Dynamic Omniscience is a new term for an old belief in the Living God. It is defined as God‚Äôs active awareness and complete knowledge based in a temporally present perception of reality; accounting for the various epistemic categories of knowledge in light of its cognate expressions.

It‚Äôs quite a mouthful‚Ä¶ but, it rests upon 4 essential Christian beliefs: 

1. God is living
2. God is free
3. Sin is rebellion
4. Jesus IS resurrected

The original debate can be viewed here: https://youtu.be/FDfSHEZTs4s

title: Jesus Saved us from God? - PSA Examined
description:
#PenalSubstitution #PSA #Atonement

DID JESUS FULFILL ALL THE OLD TESTAMENT SACRIFICES & SAVE US FROM GOD?

This is the 7th and final episode in a 7 Part Series exploring the doctrine of Penal Substitutionary Atonement, abbreviated as PSA. Here, we detail and review the claims 16 through 17 and the problems they face both with Scripture and the other claims of this Atonement Theory. 

Did Jesus fulfill ALL the Old Testament Sacrifices? Did Jesus save us from God, from the devil, or from the grave - how should the ransom be understood?

Joining Idol Killer throughout the entirety of this series is Paul Vendredi, who himself produced a long running podcast detailing PSA's claims and problems. 

--------

The 17 Claims of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA).

1. Adam‚Äôs federal headship of humanity makes all mankind guilty of his sin. (Augustine) 
2. Thanks to the transmission of original sin, mankind is now totally depraved. (Augustine) 
3. Even infants, innocent of actual sin, are guilty of original sin. (Augustine) 
4. This sin, apparently so minor, infinitely offends God because the gravity of an offense depends on the status of the one offended. (Anselm) 
5. All sin is to be understood as a debt that we owe God for the crime of having dishonored him. (Anselm) 
6. Even infants owe this debt. (Anselm) 
7. In the Old Testament era, God insists that this debt be paid by one‚Äôs shedding an innocent animal‚Äôs blood. (Aquinas & Atonement School) 
8. God could have redeemed man by the simple act of willing it... (Anselm) 
9. ...But God cannot forgive a sin without first punishing the sinner. (Anselm) 
10. Not only must the redemption mirror the fall, but it must also be as painful as possible since the fall was so easy. (Anselm) 
11. Only the death of a god-man is worthy to serve as recompense to God for his offended honor. (Anselm) 
12. Christ becomes incarnate so that his humanity can suffer as a substitute for us. (Anselm) 
13. God pours out his wrath and judgment upon the crucified Christ, imputing mankind‚Äôs wickedness to Christ and Christ‚Äôs righteousness to mankind. Man thereby becomes positionally righteous; Christ becomes positionally wicked. This imputation is a legal declaration, not an actual change in nature. (Atonement School) 
14. Bearing the imputed sins of all humanity, the crucified Christ becomes the embodiment of sin and a literal curse. (Atonement School) 
15. God, too holy to look upon sin, turns his back on Christ, abandoning him, judging him, and in effect driving him out of the Trinity‚ÄîGod damns Christ. (Atonement School) 
16. As the perfect, unblemished offering, Christ‚Äôs sacrificial death appeases God‚Äôs wrath once and for all, ransoming us from the wrath of God and bringing an end to the Old Testament sacrificial system, as symbolized by the tearing of the temple veil. (Anselm, Atonement School) 
17. Thus, Christ‚Äôs death ransoms humanity from God‚Äôs wrath. (Anselm)

title: Jesus Became Sin on a Tree - Todd White
description:
TODD WHITE BELIEVES JESUS BECAME SIN ON THE CROSS.

Recently Todd White of Lifestyle Christianity recently gave a controversial sermon. It was so shocking that it was soon removed from his YouTube channel. In the video, White gave his interpretation of 2 Corinthians 5:17-21... specifically focusing on the portion where "Jesus became sin" for us. This Todd seemingly took to mean Jesus literally "became sin on a tree".

Calvinists and Reformed teachers and preachers were pretty quick to jump on him for such statements, and his stunning examples. They claimed he was unregenerate, lost, unsaved, a false teacher, a heretic, etc.

Yet, none of White's detractors seemingly take issue with other Calvinists for asserting the same thing. Men like RC Sproul taught that Jesus became sin incarnate, a mass of sin, became a literal curse, etc... and Charles Spurgeon noted how men cannot exchange their sin with another, but this is possible for God.

So why are Calvinists condemning White as an unbeliever and turning a blind eye to their own teachers who White apparently learned this from?

Also in this video are comments from Justin Peters, a Calvinist Preacher, condemning Todd White as an unsaved, unregenerate false teacher. These clips are used to demonstrate the Reformed camp's response to White, while also ironically highlighting the problems with Sproul and Spurgeon. Justin's original video can be seen here: https://youtu.be/uUHZN1kxb48

John MacArthur holds a gnostic view of sin wherein sin is a substance to be transferred and exchanged; thus he believes the greatest act of depravity is when a husband and wife become pregnant. title: Pure No More - A Cry From Heaven - RC Sproul
description:
RC SPROUL BELIEVES JESUS BECAME IMPURE & GOD DAMNED HIM AT THE CROSS.

The lengths men will go to in defending Penal Substitutionary Atonement is astounding. In this polemical work, we took several clips from RC Sproul teaching that Jesus died impure, sin incarnate, cursed and forsaken by God. The original clip: https://youtu.be/Lgwpd0SKpmc

In Isaiah 53 we read that men cursed Jesus and claimed it was actually God who cursed Him, yet there was Jesus - God with us - laying down His life to redeem and deliver us in a display of selfless love and mercy.

Sproul argues that Jesus didn't suffer and die unjustly, but that He became sinful so the punishment was just. This denies that Jesus was the Spotless and sinless lamb. Instead, he argues that Jesus was the MOST sinful human to ever walk the planet.

This is a blasphemous view of God, stemming from a Gnostic view of sin, wherein sin is a substance. It causes God's justice and mercy to become perverted and disrupts the unity of the Triune God. They claim Jesus became sinful and cursed because God is incapable of genuinely forgiving the repentant. Thus they claim God punished the most innocent, most righteous, most good, most upright man to ever walk the earth... and they claim because of this they are free to live how they please as they're among the elect for whom Jesus suffered the punishment of all their past, present and future sins.

This is an obscene and heretical view of the Redemptive work of Christ! Yet, popular teachers like RC Sproul, John MacArthur and others teach this wickedness as though it were truth.

---------

In the original clip (linked above) Sproul recognizes Jesus' cry in Matthew 27:46 is referencing Psalm 22, yet he dismisses it in order to blaspheme against Jesus.
