title: Most Sinful Man In The Universe - PSA  Examined
description:
#PenalSubstitution #PSA #Atonement

JESUS ACCORDING TO PENAL SUBSTITUTIONARY ATONEMENT.

How is the the crucified Christ viewed under PSA? Do the words "Hated by God", "An Obscene Incarnation", "Cursed" and "A Mass of Sin" come to mind when you think of Jesus laying down His life for mankind?

They shouldn't, but this is often how adherents of the Atonement School describe Him, while explaining Penal Substitution.

This is the 6th episode in a 7 Part Series exploring the doctrine of Penal Substitutionary Atonement, abbreviated as PSA. Here, we detail and review claims 13 through 15 and their conflict with the account of Scripture: Did God pour out His wrath on Jesus? Did Jesus become a literal curse? Did God really turn His back on Jesus?

Joining Idol Killer for the entirety of this series is Paul Vendredi, who himself produced a long running podcast detailing PSA's claims and problems. YES! Paul assures us he will upload this series soon for everyone to enjoy. We will post links when that happens.

--------

The 17 Claims of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA).

1. Adam‚Äôs federal headship of humanity makes all mankind guilty of his sin. (Augustine) 
2. Thanks to the transmission of original sin, mankind is now totally depraved. (Augustine) 
3. Even infants, innocent of actual sin, are guilty of original sin. (Augustine) 
4. This sin, apparently so minor, infinitely offends God because the gravity of an offense depends on the status of the one offended. (Anselm) 
5. All sin is to be understood as a debt that we owe God for the crime of having dishonored him. (Anselm) 
6. Even infants owe this debt. (Anselm) 
7. In the Old Testament era, God insists that this debt be paid by one‚Äôs shedding an innocent animal‚Äôs blood. (Aquinas & Atonement School) 
8. God could have redeemed man by the simple act of willing it... (Anselm) 
9. ...But God cannot forgive a sin without first punishing the sinner. (Anselm) 
10. Not only must the redemption mirror the fall, but it must also be as painful as possible since the fall was so easy. (Anselm) 
11. Only the death of a god-man is worthy to serve as recompense to God for his offended honor. (Anselm) 
12. Christ becomes incarnate so that his humanity can suffer as a substitute for us. (Anselm) 
13. God pours out his wrath and judgment upon the crucified Christ, imputing mankind‚Äôs wickedness to Christ and Christ‚Äôs righteousness to mankind. Man thereby becomes positionally righteous; Christ becomes positionally wicked. This imputation is a legal declaration, not an actual change in nature. (Atonement School) 
14. Bearing the imputed sins of all humanity, the crucified Christ becomes the embodiment of sin and a literal curse. (Atonement School) 
15. God, too holy to look upon sin, turns his back on Christ, abandoning him, judging him, and in effect driving him out of the Trinity‚ÄîGod damns Christ. (Atonement School) 
16. As the perfect, unblemished offering, Christ‚Äôs sacrificial death appeases God‚Äôs wrath once and for all, ransoming us from the wrath of God and bringing an end to the Old Testament sacrificial system, as symbolized by the tearing of the temple veil. (Anselm, Atonement School) 
17. Thus, Christ‚Äôs death ransoms humanity from God‚Äôs wrath. (Anselm)

--------

title: Anselm's First 3 Claims - Penal Substitutionary Atonement
description:
#PenalSubstitution #PSA #Atonement

ANSELM'S CONTRIBUTION TO PENAL SUBSTITUTIONARY ATONEMENT.

This is the third episode in a 7 Part Series exploring the Augustinian Doctrine of Penal Substitution, abbreviated as PSA. In this episode, we detail and review Anselm's contributions to PSA.

Joining Idol Killer for the entirety of this series is *Paul Vendredi, who himself produced a long running podcast detailing PSA's claims and problems.

*We ran into some technical difficulties in this recording and as such the audio is less than ideal. We did our best to clean it up, but moving forward all subsequent episodes will have Paul in a professional studio and with much improved audio.

--------

Anselm's First Three Contributions:

1. Infinite Offense: the belief that any sin is an infinite offense against the holy God & thus demands an equal reparation.

2. Sin is a Debt: the belief that sin steals honor and glory from God, diminishing Him and thus must be repaid.

3. Infants Owe this Debt: the belief that everyone is created owing God for robbing Him of honor.

--------

The 17 Claims of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA).

1. Adam‚Äôs federal headship of humanity makes all mankind guilty of his sin. (Augustine) 
2. Thanks to the transmission of original sin, mankind is now totally depraved. (Augustine) 
3. Even infants, innocent of actual sin, are guilty of original sin. (Augustine) 
4. This sin, apparently so minor, infinitely offends God because the gravity of an offense depends on the status of the one offended. (Anselm) 
5. All sin is to be understood as a debt that we owe God for the crime of having dishonored him. (Anselm) 
6. Even infants owe this debt. (Anselm) 
7. In the Old Testament era, God insists that this debt be paid by one‚Äôs shedding an innocent animal‚Äôs blood. (Aquinas & Atonement School) 
8. God could have redeemed man by the simple act of willing it... (Anselm) 
9. ...But God cannot forgive a sin without first punishing the sinner. (Anselm) 
10. Not only must the redemption mirror the fall, but it must also be as painful as possible since the fall was so easy. (Anselm) 
11. Only the death of a god-man is worthy to serve as recompense to God for his offended honor. (Anselm) 
12. Christ becomes incarnate so that his humanity can suffer as a substitute for us. (Anselm) 
13. God pours out his wrath and judgment upon the crucified Christ, imputing mankind‚Äôs wickedness to Christ and Christ‚Äôs righteousness to mankind. Man thereby becomes positionally righteous; Christ becomes positionally wicked. This imputation is a legal declaration, not an actual change in nature. (Atonement School) 
14. Bearing the imputed sins of all humanity, the crucified Christ becomes the embodiment of sin and a literal curse. (Atonement School) 
15. God, too holy to look upon sin, turns his back on Christ, abandoning him, judging him, and in effect driving him out of the Trinity‚ÄîGod damns Christ. (Atonement School)

title: Penal Substitution's First 3 Claims - Augustinian Anthropology
description:
#PenalSubstitution #PSA #Atonement

AUGUSTINE'S CONTRIBUTION TO PENAL SUBSTITUTIONARY ATONEMENT.

This is the second episode in a 7 Part Series exploring the Augustinian Doctrine of Penal Substitution, abbreviated as PSA. In this episode, we detail and review the first three claims of PSA, as developed by Augustine: Original Sin, Total Depravity & Infant Depravity.

Joining Idol Killer for the entirety of this series is Paul Vendredi, who himself produced a long running podcast detailing PSA's claims and problems.

--------

The Big Three:

1. Original Sin: the belief that as a result of Adam's sin, all mankind is created sinful and guilty, stained by concupiscence as mankind was in Adam's loins when he sinned.

2. Total Depravity: the belief Adam's corruption extends to all parts of his progeny, from the flesh to the soul, from the will to the intellect. As a result all mankind is born spiritually dead and unable to respond to God.

3. Infant Depravity: the belief that Original Sin and Total Depravity affects everyone the moment they come into existence, thus infants enter the world under God's wrath and deserving judgment.

--------

The 17 Claims of Penal Substitutionary Atonement (PSA).

1. Adam‚Äôs federal headship of humanity makes all mankind guilty of his sin. (Augustine) 
2. Thanks to the transmission of original sin, mankind is now totally depraved. (Augustine) 
3. Even infants, innocent of actual sin, are guilty of original sin. (Augustine) 
4. This sin, apparently so minor, infinitely offends God because the gravity of an offense depends on the status of the one offended. (Anselm) 
5. All sin is to be understood as a debt that we owe God for the crime of having dishonored him. (Anselm) 
6. Even infants owe this debt. (Anselm) 
7. In the Old Testament era, God insists that this debt be paid by one‚Äôs shedding an innocent animal‚Äôs blood. (Aquinas & Atonement School) 
8. God could have redeemed man by the simple act of willing it... (Anselm) 
9. ...But God cannot forgive a sin without first punishing the sinner. (Anselm) 
10. Not only must the redemption mirror the fall, but it must also be as painful as possible since the fall was so easy. (Anselm) 
11. Only the death of a god-man is worthy to serve as recompense to God for his offended honor. (Anselm) 
12. Christ becomes incarnate so that his humanity can suffer as a substitute for us. (Anselm) 
13. God pours out his wrath and judgment upon the crucified Christ, imputing mankind‚Äôs wickedness to Christ and Christ‚Äôs righteousness to mankind. Man thereby becomes positionally righteous; Christ becomes positionally wicked. This imputation is a legal declaration, not an actual change in nature. (Atonement School) 
14. Bearing the imputed sins of all humanity, the crucified Christ becomes the embodiment of sin and a literal curse. (Atonement School) 
15. God, too holy to look upon sin, turns his back on Christ, abandoning him, judging him, and in effect driving him out of the Trinity‚ÄîGod damns Christ. (Atonement School) 
16. As the perfect, unblemished offering, Christ‚Äôs sacrificial death appeases God‚Äôs wrath once and for all, ransoming us from the wrath of God and bringing an end to the Old Testament sacrificial system, as symbolized by the tearing of the temple veil. (Anselm, Atonement School) 
17. Thus, Christ‚Äôs death ransoms humanity from God‚Äôs wrath. (Anselm)

-------

2:51 A Brief History (Anselm & Augustine)

16:08 Roll Back the Tape
18:49 Cognitive Dissonance

title: On Augustine & Original Sin - Responding to Alisa Childers & Ken Samples
description:
#OriginalSin #AlisaChilders #Augustine

RESPONDING TO ALISA CHILDERS & KEN SAMPLES

Recently, Alisa Childers interviewed Ken Samples on the topic of Augustine and Original Sin, as well as touching on Penal Substitution. The original video was entitled "Did St. Augustine Invent The Doctrine of Original Sin Because He Had Sexual Issues?" (https://youtu.be/nz6Ro1faoFk)

The video frames the question in such a way that one can focus on the WHY of the question, rather than the IF and in doing so, ignore the implications. Moreover, the video repeatedly linked rejecting Augustinian philosophy with "liberal" and "progressive" Christians. 

If one were not paying close attention, if one were not studied in these topics, a viewer might watch this and well assume Augustinian philosophy is Biblical, when in fact the opposite is true. 

This response video seeks to set the record straight and address some errors the original presentation included. This is NOT a hit piece against either Childers or Samples, but a much needed correction of the record.

title: Insane Doctrine - RC Sproul Refutes Determinism
description:
RC SPROUL REFUTES THE WESTMINSTER CONFESSION OF FAITH.

In this polemical work, various clips of RC Sproul claiming denial of the Westminster Confession of Faith (WCoF) makes one an atheist and arguing if determinism is true then such arguments are worthless are edited together to reveal the inconsistencies within his theology.

The WCoF pushes determinism and RC claimed to deny it made one an atheist. Of course when combating atheism, he argued against determinism. All revealing his inconsistencies and the internal contradictions within Calvinism.

If God decreed whatsoever comes to pass, then this would include all things such as evil and our thoughts. Thus, in attempting to convince others determinism is true the arguing party reveals they don't really believe their own claim; as they're assuming the other agent is free to respond and consider their claims. However, if determinism were true then persuasion is irrelevant, as is truth itself.

No, many Christians reject the WCoF, Calvinism & determinism as they believe the Bible apart from Augustinian philosophical presuppositions.

#RCSproul #Determinism #RadioSovereignGeneva

title: RC Sproul's Theodicy & Blasphemy of the Holy Spirit
description:
RC SPROUL TELLS US ABOUT BLASPHEMY OF THE HOLY SPIRIT & THEODICY

What is blasphemy of the Holy Spirit? According to RC Sproul, its recognizing that Jesus is God and accusing Him of being a devil. Theodicy is an explanation for the existence of evil, specifically a defense of God in light of evil's existence.

RC Sproul affirmed the Westminster Confession of Faith and was an Augustinian. As such, he concluded God ordained whatsoever comes to pass. Ordain means to confer holy orders, command and decree... thus to ordain evil is to be the cause of evil.

This polemical work is intended to show how if one is consistent with their application of determinism, as articulated by Augustine, the Westminster Confession and Sproul... one must conclude God is responsible for all evil in the world. You will note how RC Sproul insinuates here that God created Adam and Eve intending them to sin.

#RCSproul #Theodicy #RadioSovereignGeneva

title: God's Fault - Who is Responsible for Evil?
description:
JOHN MACARTHUR, RC SPROUL & JAMES WHITE BLAME GOD FOR EVIL.

This video uses the words of well known Calvinists to expose and refute Calvinism. Often this employs using one statement they made to refute another statement they made. In some cases liberty has been taken with their words to rebuke their position. 

Most of the clips of JMac come from the link below and his sermon: "Why Does God Allow So Much Suffering and Evil?" This of course is a polemical work intended to refute not only MacArthur, not only Calvinism, but all of Theistic Determinism. This system believes God has decreed everything, including every act of evil; that He is not allowing evil acts but rather is the ultimate causal agent by way of His immutable eternal decree. 

This of course is contrary to Scripture and accuses God of all evil. JMac is joined here with soundbites from RC Sproul & James White who likewise are notable adherents of this faulty philosophy.

It is our hope that this causes Calvinists, including MacArthur and White, to repent from such beliefs and stop blaming God for sin and evil. Rather, we are God's imagebearers, and as such were created with genuine freewill and self-determination. For this reason, sin originates not in the mind or decree of God, but with His wayward imagebearers.

Contrary to the claims made by Calvinists, God did not create evil. Evil is death and meaningless. However, God is Life and can use such things to bless and bring life to those who trust Him. If you've been hurt by evil men, that was NOT your Father in heaven hurting you through them. He hates evil and will judge them for it.

If you've believed the lie that God created perfect evil, repent and run home. The Father is waiting and willing to forgive. He's far greater than you imagined.

#JohnMacArthur #Calvinism #RadioSovereignGeneva

title: Perfect Evil - A Reformed Apologetic
description:
GOD DECREES EVERY ACT OF EVIL

Various clips from James White of @AominOrg (@Alpha & Omega Ministries) were used to create this polemical work. As he is a theistic determinist, James believes God has decreed everything, including every act of evil; that He is not merely permitting evil acts but rather is the ultimate causal agent - that God effectually decreed every act of evil into existence.

This of course is contrary to Scripture and accuses God of all evil. White does this as a result of affirming Calvinism and Classical Theism. This work is intended to reveal a monumental problem within his view.

This is a polemical work using statements James White made on various programs affirming God creates and decrees all evil. Keep in mind, two statements were made wherein James and his cohost restate objections commonly raised by non-Calvinists, that this means God forces men to sin and is the author of child abuse. While both quoted these objection, neither were able to overcome them via their commitment to "Reformed Apologetics" and presuppositional commitment to Calvinism.

It is our hope that this causes Calvinists, including James White, to repent from such beliefs and stop blaming God for all sin and evil. Rather, we are God's imagebearers, and as such were created with genuine freewill and self-determination. For this reason, sin originates not in the mind or decree of God, but with His wayward imagebearers.

Contrary to the claims made by White, God did not create evil. Evil is death, rebellion and meaningless. However, God is Life and can redeem such things to bless and bring life to those who trust Him. If you've been hurt by evil men, that was NOT your Father in heaven hurting you through them. He hates evil, calls them to repent and will judge them for rebellion.

If you've believed the lie that God created perfect evil, repent and run home. The Father is waiting and willing to forgive. He's far greater than you imagined.

#JamesWhite #Calvinism #Alpha&OmegaMinistries #RadioSovereignGeneva

title: What is a Consistent Theology?
description:

title: When Sovereignty Causes Doubt - Can we trust God - Why should we?
description:
HOW VIEWS ON GOD'S SOVEREIGNTY CAN CREATE DOUBT & DISBELIEF. It's often argued that God is sovereign, by which they mean God has decreed everything that comes to pass including all sin and evil. Such a view is blasphemous, accusing God of desiring evil. Moreover, it places the accuser in peril, but also whoever might listen to such slander. 

Those who have suffered abuse and trauma are often seeking to heal and recover, looking to God to work through such evils to bring about good. However, for one to believe that it was God bringing about the abuse and trauma, to whom can they turn? When they believe God was the ultimate abuser, where can they run but away from Him? 

Such perverse views on God sacrifice His holiness and love, worshipping an idol called "power", "might" & "sovereignty" which is nothing more than an empty chair without the heart of God seated there. So instead of looking to God for comfort and healing, restoration and deliverance, many come to view Him as the ultimate abuser and thus shipwreck their faith.

In this episode, Idol Killer reviews a meme that's been popular on religious forums recently, as well as the claims that God either must decree evil or He is a perverted voyeur watching it happen and refusing to help. The truth is something else entirely! 

#Sovereignty #God #Omnipotence

title: Does Evil Disprove God? Walking Through Theodicy
description:
THEODICY & THE PROBLEM OF EVIL

Does the existence of evil in the world disprove the existence of God? That's what many have argued, but here Idol Killer considers the arguments and offers an explanation. We discuss Epicurus, Pierre Gassendi & David Hume - reviewing the argument and considering various explanations. We examine various Theistic responses and weigh the pros and cons of each.

Does evil exist? Yes.

Now the argument commonly made arises. If God is all knowing, then He knows of evil. If He is all powerful, then He could stop evil. If He is good, then He would. Thus, since evil runs rampant and unimpeded, God does not exist. 

However, the argument fails to recognize a central aspect of God's character... chiefly that He is patient, not willing that any should perish. Thus He call men to repentance and employs the faithful into the ministry of reconciliation. Moreover, God has given us laws and consequences. Evildoers do suffer these consequences woven into creation and should they not repent, they will face God's judgment. Additionally, God often restrains the evil men do, yet in some instances will enact a judgment by ceasing such restraint and allowing the evil to destroy themselves.

Another point to consider is that in recognizing the existence of evil, men acknowledge a transcendent standard which God has written on their hearts. To know what evil is, is to know it is opposed to good. Thus to recognize the existence of the counterfeit is to acknowledge the existence of the genuine. So we see man innately knows good and evil, thus recognizing the existence of God.

üìö The Problem of Pain by C.S. Lewis

title: Semi-Pelagianism w/ Dr Kurt Jaros
description:
WHAT IS SEMI-PELAGIANISM?

Dr Kurt Jaros joins Idol Killer to discuss all things semi-Pelagian. What is semi-Pelagianism, who are the semi-Pelagians, where does the term come from, what are semi-Pelagian beliefs, how does this relate to free will, sin and more? All of these questions will be explored in this interview.

Kurt Jaros is the Executive Director of Defenders Media, a non-profit he founded in 2015. For four years he was the host of the Veracity Hill podcast, creating 200 episodes about faith, politics, and society. He is an affiliate faculty member at the Lee Strobel Center for Evangelism and Applied Apologetics at Colorado Christian University. He holds multiple graduate degrees in theology and apologetics, and received his doctorate from the University of Aberdeen in Scotland. He is a devout Chicago Cubs fan and pledges his allegiance to Dr. Pepper. He resides with his family in the western suburbs of Chicago.

title: What the Heck is a Faulty Generalization?
description:
#Shorts

Not Every Doctrine Has the Same Biblical Support as the Trinity. The doctrine of the Trinity certainly has Biblical support, but the term "Trinity" is absent from the text. In an effort to defend extra-Biblical doctrines which are in opposition to Scripture, many will point to the Trinity. 

The argument is presented that since the term "Trinity" absent from the Bible, then any doctrine they hold which is absent from Scripture is equally as valid.  

The problem is that this is not an actual argument, as these are separate doctrines which must be weighed according to their own merits. Instead, appeals to the Trinity are an argument from silence by way of a faulty generalization‚Ä¶ a logical fallacy‚Ä¶ and this can be used to support literally any claim, regardless of how baseless.

‚ÄúIn heaven we all get to ride talking unicorns‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs in the Bible right next to the part about the Trinity!‚Äù

title: What the Heck is the Starbucks Fallacy? #shorts
description:
Adherents of Augustinian philosophy embrace the concept known as Original Sin. That is, that since Adam's sin in Eden, all mankind is now born with their flesh, will, mind and soul stained by sin. 

This creates serious problems when applied to the incarnation of Jesus Christ. In Hebrews 2:14-18 we read that Jesus came in our flesh and blood, like us in EVERY respect.

"Since therefore the children share in flesh and blood, he himself likewise partook of the SAME THINGS, that through death he might destroy the one who has the power of death, that is, the devil, and deliver all those who through fear of death were subject to lifelong slavery. For surely it is not angels that he helps, but he helps the offspring of Abraham. Therefore he had to be made like his brothers in EVERY RESPECT, so that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in the service of God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people. For because he himself has suffered when tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted." Hebrews 2:14-18

So, if we are born with our flesh, will, soul and mind stained by sin - and Jesus came like us in every respect, then Jesus would be just as sinful. Which corrupts the incarnation and denies His role as the Spotless Redeemer who knew no sin.

Augustinians often seek to Move the Goalposts, and redefine our nature to include things like drinking frappuccinos, our ethnicity or something other than our flesh, will, soul and mind. This is known as the Starbucks Fallacy.

#shorts #apologetics

title: Who the Heck was Augustine of Hippo?
description:
#shorts #Augustine

Roman Catholicism and Reformed Protestants stand on the foundation of Augustinian philosophy. So who was Augustine and what did he believe?

Augustine: Sex with your wife for pleasure is worse than with a prostitute.

"For, whereas that natural use, when it pass beyond the compact of marriage, that is, beyond the necessity of begetting, is pardonable in the case of a wife, damnable in the case of an harlot; that which is against nature is execrable when done in the case of an harlot, but MORE execrable in the case of a wife... the wife is more shameful, if she allows it to take place in her own case, than if in the case of another woman." Of the Good of Marriage - Augustine of Hippo

Augustine: the use of violence to force conversion to Christianity is acceptable.

"For originally my opinion was, that no one should be coerced into the unity of Christ, that we must act only by words, fight only by arguments, and prevail by force of reason, lest we should have those whom we knew as avowed heretics feigning themselves to be Catholics. But this opinion of mine was overcome not by the words of those who controverted it, but by the conclusive instances to which they could point. For, in the first place, there was set over against my opinion my own town, which, although it was once wholly on the side of Donatus, was brought over to the Catholic UNITY BY FEAR of the imperial edicts, but which we now see filled with such detestation of your ruinous perversity, that it would scarcely be believed that it had ever been involved in your error. There were so many others which were mentioned to me by name, that, from facts themselves, I was made to own that to this matter the word of Scripture might be understood as applying: Give opportunity to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser. Proverbs 9:9 For how many were already, as we assuredly know, willing to be Catholics, being moved by the indisputable plainness of truth, but daily putting off their avowal of this through fear of offending their own party! How many were bound, not by truth‚Äî for you never pretended to that as yours ‚Äî but by the heavy chains of inveterate custom, so that in them was fulfilled the divine saying: A servant (who is hardened) will not be corrected by words; for though he understand, he will not answer! Proverbs 29:19 How many supposed the sect of Donatus to be the true Church, merely because ease had made them too listless, or conceited, or sluggish, to take pains to examine Catholic truth! How many would have entered earlier had not the calumnies of slanderers, who declared that we offered something else than we do upon the altar of God, shut them out! How many, believing that it mattered not to which party a Christian might belong, remained in the schism of Donatus only because they had been born in it, and no one was compelling them to forsake it and pass over into the Catholic Church!" Letter 93 - Augustine of Hippo

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 9 - The Two Ways of Man & Ephesians 2:1-3
description:
#originalsin‚Äã #totaldepravity‚Äã #bornsinners‚Äã

DOES EPHESIANS 2 TEACH WE ARE BORN WITH A SINFUL NATURE? In this episode we consider the Bible and early Church's views on the Two Ways God sets before men, and how this relates to Ephesians 2:1-3. God sets before each of us a choice: Life or Death, obedience or rebellion, a blessing and a curse. When we sin, we choose a path that leads to death & when we trust and follow God, we are trusting the very source of life Himself.

"Little children, let no one deceive you. Whoever practices righteousness is righteous, as he is righteous. Whoever makes a practice of sinning is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. The reason the Son of God appeared was to destroy the works of the devil." 1 John 3:7-8

What is Dynamic Omniscience? Is it consistent with Scripture? Has it been affirmed in the past? Does this deny God has perfect knowledge? These are but some of the questions we will be answering!

Dr. Sanders is an American theologian who has authored and edited seven books as well as over three dozen articles and book chapters. Three of his books were named in Christianity Today magazine‚Äôs books of the year awards. He has a doctorate in theology, spent a year as the Dominic Crosson Fellow at the Center for Philosophy of Religion at the University of Notre Dame, and is presently professor of religious studies at Hendrix College in Arkansas.

Most of Dr Sanders‚Äô publications are on four topics: (1) open theism, (2) Christian views on the salvation of non-Christians for which he is a proponent of what is called inclusivism, (3) Christian views on the nature of hell, and (4) applying cognitive linguistics to theology. title: Guess What Augustinians? You're Pelagian!
description:
ARE YOU UNKNOWINGLY A PELAGIAN? 
Recently, Dr Ali Bonner joined Idol Killer to discuss her work on The Myth of Pelagianism. During the course of the interview, Dr Bonner noted how the works of Pelagius had survived, being passed around and attributed to Jerome and even the Canons of the Council of Nicaea.

This means two things:

1. The ACTUAL teachings of Pelagius were revered as orthodox and thus were foundational to doctrinal development. Pelagius was NOT a Pelagian. Pelagianism is comprised of 14 unique charges which Augustine cobbled together to slander him. Of the 14 points, Pelagius only affirmed half of one point.

2. If your theology agrees with these works, meaning Christian orthodoxy, or your beliefs have been influenced by these writings or by the teaching of men who have been so influenced... then you're Pelagian! - in the sense of agreeing with Pelagius, not the 14 points falsely attributed to him by Augustine.

Perhaps it is time to cease using the Pelagian Boogeyman and seriously engage the arguments in light of Scripture. Perhaps it's time Augustinians cease falsely accusing an orthodox follower of Christ and repent.

title: The Myth of Pelagianism - An Interview With Dr Ali Bonner
description:
THE MYTH OF PELAGIANISM

Warren McGrew of Idol Killer sits down with Dr Ali Bonner to discuss Pelagius in light of recent scholarship. 

What is Pelagianism? Where did it come from? Did Pelagius believe in "Pelagianism"? Why did Augustine condemn Pelagius and Pelagianism? All of these questions and more are explored in this interview.

After reading Classics at Oxford, Alice Bonner studied Anglo Saxon, Norse, and Celtic in Cambridge, where she gained a BA (Aff.) and MPhil, followed by a PhD on the manuscript transmission of Pelagius' Letter to Demetrias. Subsequently she was a British Academy Postdoctoral Fellow at Jesus College, Oxford, before being appointed to the Lectureship in Celtic History at Cambridge. Her research focuses on Pelagius and Faustus of Riez, two British authors of the fifth century who wrote in Latin, and she has published on St Patrick and Pelagius. She currently teaches on Celtic history, that is, the history of the Brittonic speaking peoples and the Gaelic speaking peoples from AD 380 to 1170

title: Are Babies Born Sinful - The Spiritual Condition of Infants - w/ Adam Harwood
description:
ARE BABIES BORN SINFUL?

Dr. Adam Harwood joins Idol Killer to discuss the spiritual condition of infants.

Does the Bible teach we are created sinful? Are infants born guilty? Do babies go to hell? Is there good news for those who have experienced the heartache of losing of a child? 

Dr. Harwood is a Professor of Theology (occupying the McFarland Chair of Theology), Director of the Baptist Center for Theology & Ministry, and Editor of the Journal for Baptist Theology & Ministry at New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary in New Orleans (NOBTS), Louisiana. Previously, he served for 13 years in church staff positions in Oklahoma and Texas. Prior to being elected to the faculty of NOBTS in 2013, he taught at three other institutions. He holds a B.A. (1996) in History Education from the University of Central Oklahoma and an M.Div. (2001) and Ph.D. in Theology (2007) from Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary. Also, he has served since 2017 as a chaplain in the Louisiana Army National Guard.

title: What is Open Theism? - Is it HERESY? - w/ Chris Fisher
description:
WHAT IS OPEN THEISM?

Chris Fisher, of God is Open & Reality is Not Optional, joins Idol Killer to discuss the view known as Open Theism.

Open Theism is the Christian doctrine that the future is not closed, but open because God is alive, eternally free, and inexhaustibly creative. So is it supported by Scripture? What other views are there on the future? How does Open Theism impact our understanding of time, God's knowledge, power and decrees? 

Christopher Fisher is a blogger at RealityisNotOptional.com and the lead editor of GodisOpen.com. He hosts the God is Open podcast, which covers topics ranging from Early Christian history to logical fallacies. He graduated from the University of South Dakota in 2006, Cum Laude with both Computer Science and Political Science majors and both Mathematics and Economics minors. His honor's thesis was on Platonic influences in the early Christian Church: "The Hellenization of Christianity: A Defense of Open Theism".

Fr. Panayiotis Papageorgiou, Ph.D sits down with Idol Killer to discuss the origins, beliefs and practices of Eastern Orthodoxy.

Panayiotis has a long list of accomplishments which include a Master‚Äôs Degree in Chemical Engineering, a Master of Divinity with High Distinction from Holy Cross Greek Orthodox School of Theology in Boston, a Ph.D. from Catholic University of America in Washington, D.C. with a specialization in the history and theology of the Early Christian Church. title: What Is The Biblical View of Hell - Is Hell Eternal Suffering? - w/ Chris Date
description:
WHAT IS THE BIBLICAL VIEW OF HELL?

Chris Date joins Idol Killer to discuss all things related to hell.

What are the Biblical descriptions of hell? Who goes to hell? Is hell a literal place? Do people suffer forever in hell, or are they destroyed?... and why is it important for Christians to have a well defined view of hell?

title: What is Pelagianism & Is It Heresy? - Augustine's 14 Point Charge
description:
WHAT IS PELAGIANISM?

Warren McGrew of Idol Killer sits down to discuss the different definitions of Pelagianism, but particularly Augustine's 14 points he claimed comprised Pelagianism. Warren references Dr Ali Bonner's book "The Myth of Pelagianism".

Is Pelagianism opposed by Scripture? Is it heresy? What does Pelagianism assert with regard to our view of God, man, sin and righteousness? 

The 14 Points of Pelagianism:

1. Adam was created mortal & would die whether he sinned or not 30:06
2. Adam‚Äôs sin harmed only Adam, not mankind 31:06
3. The law leads to heaven in the same way as the Gospel 32:21
4. Newborn infants are in the exact same state as Adam before his sin 33:27
5. The whole human race doesn‚Äôt die through Adam & live through Christ 35:12
6. Even unbaptized infants possess eternal life 36:16
7. The wealthy must renounce their possessions or they will not see the Kingdom of Heaven 37:23
8. God‚Äôs grace & help are not given for individual actions, but consist in free will, the law & teaching. 38:59
9. God‚Äòs grace is given in accord with our merits & is located in the human will 40:33
10. Only those who are without sin can be called children of God 42:04 
11. Forgetfulness & ignorance are not sinful since they‚Äôre not done willingly 42:50
12. A choice is not free if it needs God‚Äôs help 45:32
13. Our victory is not the result of God‚Äôs help, but free will 46:23
14. The soul can be as sinless as God. 47:27

title: You're a Pelagian! - A Response
description:
#Pelagian #Heresy #Theology

It is not uncommon for an adherent of Augustinian philosophy to accuse those of us who reject it as being Pelagian heretics. This label is most often applied when the Augustinian is struggling to defend their position and seeks to malign us, dismissing us without actually refuting our claims or defending their own. 

When it is pointed out that their own definitions for Pelagianism fail to apply to us, they routinely double down and cry "Heresy!" all the louder. 

Of course such a claim is demonstrably false and they are bearing false witness. So knock it off.

--

This video uses excerpts from a debate between Warren McGrew (idol killer) and Matt Slick (CARM) in which Matt accused Warren of being a Pelagian. Warren presented Mr Slick with articles Slick had written and pointed out how the label didn't represent Warren's views. However, Mr Slick continued to slander him and accuse him of being Pelagian.

Additionally, this video includes a recent segment from Dr Leighton Flowers' on Soteriology 101 in which he is addressing the issue of falsely calling people Pelagian. His comments were made before the debate and were in now way a direct response to this debate, but they're used here as they are relevant and demonstrate how we are not Pelagian.

title: Is Total Depravity True? A Debate, Warren McGrew Vs Matt Slick
description:
#Debate #TotalDepravity #Calvinism

Matt Slick of CARM vs Warren McGrew of Idol Killer.

Is Total Depravity True? A question rooted equally in Scripture and epistemology. 

While employing epistemology Matt argued against epistemology, maligning it as something heretical. However, it is simply the study of knowledge; especially with regard to its methods, validity, and scope. Epistemology is the investigation of what distinguishes a justified belief from a baseless opinion. In other words... this is what all good and noble Bereans should strive for.  

In this debate Warren presents several challenges to the doctrine of Total Depravity and reveals numerous undercutting defeaters and inconsistencies inherent in Mr. Slick's position. 

Additionally, Mr. Slick repeatedly abandoned the debate topic, redefined Total Depravity, going so far as to not only argue against his own statements made in his CARM articles, debates, teaching videos and the definition he agreed to prior to the debate, but even those positions he stated in the actual debate itself. This debate is sadly a good example of cognitive dissonance at work. 

Mr. Slick's argumentation essentially consisted of appealing to circular reasoning, calling Warren a Pelagian, asserting his own credentials as superior, misrepresenting what Warren said, appealing to confusion, mocking and condescension. He failed to address the undercutting defeaters Warren presented and repeatedly changed positions, redefining Total Depravity when he felt it was expedient to his argument.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 7 - Genesis 6:5
description:
#OriginalSin #TotalDepravity #Prooftext

DOES GENESIS 6:5 TEACH ORIGINAL SIN & TOTAL DEPRAVITY? In this episode we consider a favorite proof-text used by Augustinians who claim the Bible teaches their sin philosophy.

"The Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every intention of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually." Genesis 6:5

What is the context of this passage and what is it trying to convey? Do we actually read anything saying that men are created with wicked and evil hearts, or is this addressing a state mankind falls into, as we become corrupt and hard hearted subsequent our birth? We will consider all that Scripture has to say on this event, including both Old Testament and New Testament passages, demonstrating that Genesis 6:5 does not teach Augustinian Philosophy.

This series conducts a comprehensive examination of Augustinian inherited sin doctrines, taking a critical look at the various problems that arise in light of the Bible.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 5 - Yetzer Epithumia & Concupiscence
description:
#OriginalSin #TotalDepravity #BornSinners #Yetzer #Epithumia #Concupiscence

WHAT IS THE NATURE OF MAN ACCORDING TO THE BIBLE? In this episode we consider man's desires, drives, appetites and ambitions as understood by the Latin term Concupiscence as opposed to the Hebrew yetser and Greek epithumia.

The Hebrew term yetser describes our neutral God given drives, appetites and ambitions which can be used for good (yetzer ha-tov) or evil (yetzer ha-ra). The Greek term epithumia likewise describes our desires which can be either good or evil. However, the Latin term concupiscence has no such nuance and means sinful lust and animalistic desire. As Augustine and many in the West were unable to read Hebrew or Greek, they relied on Latin translations and as such failed to understand such distinctions.

"If you want it, it's sin... if it feels good, God hates it." This is often the view adherents of Western Christianity take with regard to our appetites, drives, ambitions and desires... but it isn't the Biblical view. Rather, the origins of this perspective are found in poor Latin translations of the Scriptures which were then filtered through neo-Platonist philosophy and Manichaean doctrine - ultimately leading to the formulation of Original Sin.

If Original Sin is true and mankind is stained with concupiscence, then this would corrupt the nature of Christ and deny His role as our Spotless Redeemer. Moreover, it would render us incapable of rightly understanding spiritual truth or even knowing if we've truly responded to God in faith. Rather we should understand God has given man ambition, drives, appetites and desires and when used as He intended they are good, but when misused they lead to sin and bondage.

This series conducts a comprehensive examination of Augustinian inherited sin doctrines, considering various passages in Scripture used to teach and refute it, as well as offers a critical look considering the various problems that may arise.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 4 - The Hypostatic Union
description:
#OriginalSin #TotalDepravity #BornSinners #HypostaticUnion

ORIGINAL SIN IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH THE HYPOSTATIC UNION. In this episode we consider the Hypostatic Union in light of Augustinian inherited sin doctrines. 

The Hypostatic Union is a Christian doctrine describing the union of Christ's human nature and His divinity in one individual existence. Original Sin asserts that all of Adam's progeny are born stained and corrupted by Original Sin. Yet, Scripture states Jesus took on all of our nature, like us in every respect, so as to redeem us. 

The Early Church was explicit in condemning any view which denied Jesus took on Himself all of human nature; our flesh, will, soul and mind - being made like us in every respect so as to redeem us. In fact, Scripture calls a denial of this the "spirit of antiChrist" (1 John 4:2-3), as it is opposed to the truth of who Jesus is and what He accomplished. Many have been deceived by this spirit, but those who truly love Jesus and desire the truth are free to repent and follow Him in truth.

Many adherents of Augustinian philosophy will seek to defend Original Sin or Total Depravity by pointing to the Hypostatic Union. However, if Jesus assumed our fallen nature to redeem us, then He assumed corruption and would be negated from being the Spotless Redeemer of Scripture. If Jesus did not assume our fallen nature, then He didn't redeem our nature. 

Here we will explore the origins of the Hypostatic Union and deep dive into this conflict between it and Augustinian philosophy, demonstrating how the two are incompatible.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 3 - The Incarnation of Christ
description:
#OriginalSin #TotalDepravity #BornSinners #Incarnation

ORIGINAL SIN & TOTAL DEPRAVITY REJECT THE INCARNATION OF CHRIST! In this episode we consider the impact Original Sin and Total Depravity have on the incarnation of Christ. Additionally, we explore the doctrines of Mary's Immaculate Conception and the Virgin Conception.

Augustinian sin doctrines assert that as a result of Adam, we're all born spiritually dead, possessing his guilt and sinful nature; that our flesh, will, soul and intellect are corrupt and we're naturally incapable of knowing God or rightly understanding spiritual truths. Yet, Scripture says Jesus came in our flesh and blood, like us in every respect (Hebrews 2:14-18). Now if our flesh is sinful and corrupt and Jesus came in our flesh, taking on every aspect of our nature, then this would result in corrupting Him, negating His role as the spotless and sinless Redeemer of mankind spoken of throughout Scripture.

Original Sin and the Incarnation of Christ are not compatible. This is why following the State Church's embrace of Augustinian philosophy, views on the virgin birth were modified in an attempt to protect Christ from the very human nature He came to assume and redeem. Thus we see the invention of Mary's own Immaculate Conception, where God spared her the stain of Original Sin when her parents conceived her. 

We're told the Immaculate Conception is a better redemptive work than the one performed by Christ, and we see how this view makes the incarnation, suffering and death of Christ pointless. As God could have easily done for mankind what He did for Mary. Such beliefs in special treatment for the Mother of Jesus (Theotokos) then resulted in her further elevation within the State Church and its subsequent Marian dogmas such as her perpetual virginity, her role as Queen of Heaven and co-Redemptrix, her heavenly assumption, Mediatrix and Mother of the Church... replacing Christ with His blessed mother whom He came to save as well as all mankind. 

This series will conduct a comprehensive examination of Augustinian inherited sin doctrines, consider various passages in Scripture used to teach and refute this, as well as take a critical look and consider the various problems that may arise.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 2 - An Undercutting Defeater
description:
#OriginalSin #TotalDepravity #BornSinners

ORIGINAL SIN AND TOTAL DEPRAVITY REFUTED! In this episode we consider an undercutting defeater for Augustinian inherited sin doctrines; Original Sin and Total Depravity. 

Both doctrines assert that man is created with our flesh, soul, will and intellect corrupt. So the logical question then arises: If you're created with a corrupt flesh, soul, will and intellect - being naturally unable to rightly know God or spiritual truths, then to what can you appeal to for validation your present understanding is valid?

To answer this question, adherents of Augustinian philosophy routinely point to their regeneration and enablement to know spiritual truths. However, as regeneration is itself a spiritual truth, such an assertion does nothing to address the undercutting defeater. 

Another common response to this problem is an appeal to divine gnosis. Essentially, the adherent will assert they just know, or have received a divine revelation from God as confirmation. However, as such a thing itself would be a spiritual truth, this too does nothing to address the undercutting defeater.

If you're created with faculties incapable of rightly understanding spiritual truth, there is nothing one can point to for validation of a correct present understanding. This is due to the adherent still being unable to utilize anything apart from their natural faculties - the flesh, soul, will and intellect they've previously asserted cannot rightly know spiritual truth.

This series will conduct a comprehensive examination of Augustinian inherited sin doctrines, consider various passages in Scripture used to teach and refute this, as well as take a critical look and consider the various problems that may arise.

title: Original Sin - A Doctrine Examined - Episode 1 - What is Original Sin & Total Depravity?
description:
#originalsin #totaldepravity #bornsinners

WHAT IS ORIGINAL SIN AND TOTAL DEPRAVITY? In this episode we review the various historical and modern articulations of both Original Sin and Total Depravity, offering a definition for each. This is intended to provide a foundation so as we consider Scripture and the views held by the early Church we can see if these teachings are correct. This is not intended to be an endorsement of these doctrines, but rather a fair representation; a Steelman.

This is the first episode in an ongoing series which will conduct a comprehensive examination of these doctrines, consider various passages in Scripture used both to teach and refute this, as well as take a critical look and consider the various problems that may arise. Each subsequent episode will reveal why these doctrines are not in keeping with Biblical Christianity and cause serious harm to the Gospel, the teaching and work of Christ.

For example, future episodes will look at how Original Sin undermines the incarnation of Christ, offers sinners an excuse for their sins, and even negates foundational principles such as the use of logic and reason to consider and know truth.

Rejection of Original Sin is often portrayed as a novel and heretical position, however it was not until the 5th century that Augustine of Hippo formulated it. Prior to this, the early church unaminously affirmed frewill, refuting determinism, that man is created innocent and able to freely do either good or evil. Moreover, the Eastern Orthodox, Anabaptists and other Christian groups reject Original Sin to this day.

title: Let Me Tell You Something About Man & God
description:
#Gospel #Christianity #Truth

Warren McGrew of Idol Killer discusses Biblical truth that has largely been lost in modern churches today. 

The Gospel is good news for all mankind. God is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance and live. Jesus came in our flesh and blood, like us in every respect, in order to destroy the works of the devil and the hold of the grave, thereby reconciling those who through fear of death were subject to a life of futility. We shouldn't fear returning to God in repentance, for He loves us greatly and will faithfully restore us.

--

Let me tell you something about man and God‚Ä¶

Scripture says we are fearfully and wonderfully created by God in our mother's womb (Psalm 139:14), that we are a marvelous work of God, entirely dependent upon Him (Psalm 22:8-10, 71:5-6), that we are His imagebearers (Genesis 1:26, 3:22).

We‚Äôre told sin is contrary to who we are and seeks to rule over us, but we must master it (Genesis 4:6-7); that we depart our initial state of innocence and go astray into sin and trespasses (Psalm 58:3, Proverbs 14:22, Hebrews 5:2), developing a nature in bondage to sin and rightly deserving judgment (Ephesians 2:1-3).  

That by our young adult years the imagination of our hearts has become set on wickedness (Genesis 8:21) and yet even in such a state as this we can come to our senses and return to the Father who draws all men to Himself (Luke 15, John 12:32, 2 Peter 3:8-10), promising to freely and abundantly pardon us, lavishing His restorative love upon us and declaring us innocent once more (Ezekiel 18, Isaiah 55:7, 1 John 1:9).

We‚Äôre told that in order to redeem man and conquer the hold of the grave that Jesus came in our flesh and blood, like us in every respect (Hebrews 2:14-18), that in the greatest example of selfless love in the history of the universe He took our suffering and our death upon Himself (John 15:13, Acts 2:24) and though He was tempted in every way as we are and though He suffered greatly, He did not stumble, He did not waiver‚Ä¶ He did not sin (1 Peter 2:22, Romans 8:3). 

We don‚Äôt have a cold and uncaring God who can‚Äôt sympathize with our suffering. We have a God who picked up His own cross and showed us just how much He understands and how far He is willing to go to save us (Hebrews 4:15).

You see man was created in the image of God and would walk with Him in paradise in the cool of the day (Genesis 1-3:8) and it‚Äôs in the arms of your Heavenly Father where you will find true freedom, love, fulfillment, joy‚Ä¶ realizing the purpose for which you were created (Ephesians 1:11-12).

God is the source of Life and all good things (John 14:6), apart from Him there is only the absence of such things‚Ä¶ pain and death (Genesis 2:17, Romans 6:23). You may be like Adam and Eve and hiding in the bushes, afraid of what He will think when He sees the mess you‚Äôve made, but when the Father sees you returning He will rush out to greet you, throw His arms around you, kiss your dirty face, cover you in His best robe, place a ring on your finger, celebrate and declare ‚ÄúMy child who was dead is alive again!‚Äù (Luke 15:11-32)

Return to Him while there is time.

--

title: Augustine's Righteous Persecution at Work
description:
***No children were harmed in the making of this video!*** 

Augustine of Hippo taught many horrible things; Original Sin, that sex with a prostitute was less sinful than with one's own wife, that baptized children still went to hell... and this video highlights another of his horrendous teachings... that one can employ violent persecution of the unbeliever or dissenter as a viable means of Christian ministry.

This brief video is polemic in nature and is intended to provoke Augustinians (Roman Catholics & Reformed) to thought and reflection, considering the soundness (or lack thereof) of such a teaching and such a teacher.

‚ÄúBut I say to you who hear, Love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, bless those who curse you, pray for those who abuse you. To one who strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from one who takes away your cloak do not withhold your tunic either. Give to everyone who begs from you, and from one who takes away your goods do not demand them back. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them. ‚ÄúIf you love those who love you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them. And if you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that to you? For even sinners do the same. And if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to get back the same amount. But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil. Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful." Luke 6:27-36

title: The Matter of Pharaoh's Heart - God's Hardening his Heart
description:
Idol Killer e5 - The Matter of Pharaoh's Heart

When considering the theological concept of God's Sovereignty from a Reformed / Calvinist view, the topic of God hardening Pharaoh's heart is often raised. After our recent episode on the sovereignty of God, requests came in asking that we address this specific instance in Scripture.

What does it mean when Scripture says God hardened Pharaoh's heart? Did God cause Pharaoh to rebel and sin? Did God make Pharaoh incapable of repentance? If Pharaoh was totally depraved and unregenerate why did God need to harden his heart? How does this instance in Scripture affect our understanding of the workings of God and His judgments? We address these questions and more in this episode.

For more visit: https://www.idolkiller.com/home/matter-of-pharaoh-heart

title: Is God Sovereign - King of kings or Ultimate Cause?
description:
WARNING: there will be some topics in this video not suitable for younger audiences. Thus the 18 and over age restriction has been enabled for this episode.

‚ÄúI believe in the Sovereignty of God!‚Äù This is a common phrase often declared from Protestant pulpits, specifically those identifying as Reformed or Calvinist ‚Äì but what does it mean?

Many Calvinist Preachers, Teachers and Commentators will assert that whatsoever comes to pass does so because it was God's will, that at some point in eternity past God decreed all things including evil and wickedness. In this view, God is somehow lessened if something happens He did not cause. However, this view does not elevate God as it adherents mistakenly believe. Instead, such claims make God out to be a devil behind Satan, commanded murder, adultery and every evil ever perpetrated. 

In this episode of Idol Killer we consider the errors of the Calvinist view of Sovereignty, as well as what the Bible actually says about God and the basic definitions of the term.

Our article: https://www.idolkiller.com/home/what-is-god-s-sovereignty

title: Mars a Parable - Sharing Your Faith Unconventionally
description:
Idol Killer - A Martian Gospel

Do you often find yourself struggling to witness, or relate your faith in a way that is understandable? Are you an atheist, agnostic or adherent of another religion trying to understand the Christian worldview? 

In this episode of Idol Killer we consider who God is and the nature of our relationship with Him in a rather unconventional way - via a modern parable entitled "Mars".

Like all parables its not perfect and there are sure to be areas in which it fails under scrutiny. However, we believe this explains things in a simple and easily understood way without resorting to legalism, or beating people over the head with the Bible. 

This brief little tale has worked rather well in building bridges where respectful discourse can occur on a topic all too divisive.

title: Who is Jesus - Spirit, Man or God incarnate?
description:
In this episode of Idol Killer we consider the life of Jean de Br√©beuf and the origin of the Huron Carol, the beliefs of Marcion of Sinope and the gnostic Cerinthus, as well as numerous passages from the Bible... answering the question "Who is Jesus?"

Was Jesus only a spirit that appeared human? Was Jesus just a man, or a man possessed by God? Is Jesus God incarnate, in our flesh? What did the early Church believe about Jesus and what did the gnostics teach about Him? 

Want to skip past the Huron Carol and Jean de Br√©beuf and get straight to the topic? Jump to the 16:33 mark.

Want to skip past the gnostics (Marcion & Cerinthus) and get to what the Bible says about Jesus? Jump to the 22:20 mark.

Want to learn more about the incarnation and how it figures into God's redemption of man? Visit www.idolkiller.com/home/the-hypostatic-union

title: God's Redemption of Man & the History of Penal Substitution
description:
God's Redemption of Man & the History of Penal Substitution (PSA).

In this edition of Idol Killer we explore the Redemption Models of the early Church (Recapitulation, Ransom & Moral Influence), as well as latter Atonement Theories (Satisfaction Theory & PSA).

Did Jesus come to enable God‚Äôs forgiveness, or did He come because God is forgiving? These Redemption Models and Atonement Theories approach this question differently.

It is virtually undisputed that today the most popular explanation of the cross is that of Penal Substitution, that God who is Holy cannot merely forgive men, but instead must pour out His wrath and chose to do so on Jesus, thereby saving us from the wrath of God. But is this what Scripture teaches? Is this explanation in keeping with what the early Church taught? When was this teaching introduced and are there any problems with it? Does Isaiah 53 teach Penal Substitution? What are the unique claims of PSA? We will answer these questions and more!

Related articles:

When God Forgives: https://www.idolkiller.com/home/when-god-forgives

God's Redemption of Man: https://www.idolkiller.com/home/the-incarnation-god-s-redemption-of-man
